Reviews.Title: “amazing and super value for money”
Reviews.Author: A J
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Spacious elegant rooms and very hospitable and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Keri-Bryan
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms for 4 nights. My parents were in a superior room on the 2nd floor, and I was in a quad (2 queen beds) on the 1st level (remember that 0 is ground level). The hotel is perfectly situated directly across the street from the Vatican museum. St Peter's square is about a 10-15 min walk along the Vatican wall...all sidewalk :) Breakfast (daily from 0730-1030) was included in our room rates and was quite generous. The hot dishes varied daily, and I believe you could ask the attendant for an espresso or cappuccino. There was plenty of coffee and even tea. Both our rooms faced the street, which can be a bit noisy...mostly cars. It didn't bother us as it was still cool outside, so we didn't have the windows open. Most of Europe's windows do not have screens, so you need to remember that the flying bugs will come in if the windows are open. The lobby is staffed 24/7, and there is a generously sized elevator that will take you to your floor. There are also steps, which you can access coming down, but not going up from the lobby(unless the lobby attendant buzzes the door). The rooms were immaculate and a good size. The superior room was a corner room and had a very large king size bed, double sink bathroom, minibar, safe, robes/slippers, hotpot for coffee/tea, and TV with Skye TV. The quad room only had one sink in the bathroom, but had robes/slippers, safe, minibar, and TV with Skye TV. My only complaint about this room was that it didn't come with a hotpot for coffee/tea. I was surprised, given the prices we paid. The rooms don't have any carpeting, so you can hear every chair being pulled across the floor as well as voices. The superior room also came with WiFi access codes. Although there wasn't any info about WiFi in my Quad room, I just used my parents' code, which worked fine down in my room. I know the hotel lobby has free WiFi. The hotel's attendants were extremely friendly, approachable and helpful! They gave us numerous directions and always had a map available for us:)) The hotel also has a shuttle service, which we didn't need to use, but I believe their price is reasonable. During our stay there were mostly families with well-behaved children. We opted to pay in cash for an 8% discount. If you decide on this option you need to pay in full at check-in. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super breakfast buffet, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ramikat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi Vaticano 7 nights to be near the Vatican. It is right across the street from the Vatican Museum. Our room on the 3rd floor was very quiet and the windows opened to the inner courtyard of the apartment building next door. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet cannot be beat. There is a rooftop terrace on the 4th floor with a good view of the Vatican and Roman rooftops. There were 2 general access terraces on the 3rd floor if you want to sit outside. The terraces are the only place smoking is allowed, but there were no smokers during our visit. You can get the 23 or 492 bus into the city center down the hill from the hotel on via Leone IV. It is a little farther to walk to restaurants, about a 15 minute walk to Borgo Pio (many restaurants). There are also some local restaurants closer on via Leone IV. It is about 5 blocks north to the covered food market on Andrea Dorea and one can get a taxi across the street, which we did to visit Galleria Borghese. Their shuttle to the airport was very reasonable and on time. It was a good choice if you want to see the Vatican completely. We did St. Peter's twice, the Vatican Museum and my husband did the Scavi and the Dome tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Larenz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right near the entrance to the Vatican Museum. It has several cafes and restaurants in the area (the farther the Vatican cheaper). The room was nice and spacious and had a balcony (3rd floor) overlooking the plaza. The breakfast staff was friendly but the reception staff, although polite, had little initiative. Overall, an Hotel to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi”
Reviews.Author: susea39
Reviews.Content: Just back fron our trip to Rome. One of our daughters is studying abroad in Rome, so we decided to visit and have our very own personal tour guide! We chose Hotel Alimandi because of the location ( not far from our daughters campus), reviews on Trip Advisor, and Rick Steves Rome book recommendation. ( Rick Steves book was our bible for the entire stay! Great tips, good history lessons, and great sense of humor!) We LOVED this hotel! Small-ish, family owned, good location, not over priced, spotless! It was so nice to have a lovely breakfast every morning and to be greeted by the chef. He was so nice! The staff at the front desk were soooo helpful. Always giving tips on good restaurants with in walking distance ( or farther away) We had room 305, which was perfect for our needs. The room was very large. Bigger than an standard Marriott or Westin. It had 2 queen beds, 3 bedside tables ( one on the outside of both beds and one in the middle), TV/ dresser/ mini bar unit, large desk with large mirror. The 2 closets were enourmous, plenty of hangers and lots of shelves, plus an additional shelf unit with safe. We chose this room because we needed the space for our daughter traveling with us, and our daughter in Rome spent a few nights with us. The bathroom was much larger than I expected, with shower, tub, toilet, bidet , and sink. There was a window in the bath that opened up to an interior courtyard. This room also had a door that went out to a terrace that overlooked the entrance to the Vatican Museum. The weather was beautiful and we had this door open quite a bit. Another window opened to the side of the building, offering plenty of light. The room was absolutely spotless! Clean white fluffy towels everyday. Have to say that the beds were a bit on the hard side, but we were so tired by the end of the day, that we didnt mind . There is a large roof top area, with table and chairs, overlooking the area. It is a nice place to meet friends or gather together for happy hour. Unfortunately, there were a couple large tour groups staying at the hotel and used this area as their late night meeting place. Chairs and table were pushed back and forth and scraped over the floor until all hours of the night. We brought this to the front desk's attention and it was taken care of right away. From then on the group had to be off the roof at 11 pm, which was appropriate. It was quiet for the rest of the time until the last night, when the same thing happened with another gathering. Fortunately, the rest of the familuy did not wake up at 3 am when the chairs were being pushed around. I think the hotel needs to take a look and make a general policy for the roof top to be closed at 11 pm. We found this hotel to be perfect for us. It is located in a great neighborhood. Grocery markets close by for snacks and wine, close to metro stops, close to shopping areas. We would definitely stay here again! We could hear the trafic somewhat, but with windows closed, the room was pretty quiet. Besides, we were so tired that the night traffic didnt bother us. p.s. When you need a taxi, have the front desk call for one and be picked up in front of hotel. Do not use the taxis across the street in front of Vatican! Also, try to learn some basic Italian phrases ( also in back of Rick Steves book) It just makes your stay that much better and clerks, hotel staff, waitstaff appreciate the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to the Vatican Museum entrance.”
Reviews.Author: MMB-9-46
Reviews.Content: Hotel is across the street from the Vatican museum, but it is a busy street with lots of traffic and noise. Check in was seamless. We paid the bill at check in, including a 10 euro per person transfer to the airport (as this was our last hotel before heading home after 18 days and 7 hotels throughout Italy). The room had 2 double beds-plenty big for a party of 3. There was a large bathroom with a tub/shower. There was a very cute welcome package with bathrobes, slippers and your typical assortment of toiletries. The 1/2 shower door made a mess of water in the bathrooom. There was a mini-bar, ample closet space and safe (although it was technically moveable) There was an excellent buffet breakfast. We didn't know about the terrace bar and computer room. Another guest told us after the fact- they didn't mention it at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Vatican and a good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Criticconsumer
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally located for the Vatican Museums, though not in the centre of the other tourist attractions of Rome. However it is near to the Metro and buses and fine if you like to walk. Hotel is very clean, with good-sized and well-furnished rooms? Only fault was our shower was abit weak and if you want to sleep late you might find the traffic a bit noisy once it gets going in the morning. Breakfast was very good with a wide selection and the lady at the reception was very helpful with trip advice and printing off check-in docs. etc. Would stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless,Clean, *******Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sandraL10021
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel many times and each time I have found front desk helpful,Pleasant,have used shuttle to and from FCO airport. Rooms and bathrooms Spotless. Beds comfortable. walking distance to sistine chapel & Vatican. first stay Oct 2000-2011

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: SnohBrind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both the hotel and the "Bed and Breakfast". The bed and breakfast rooms were a little roomier than the hotel, but both were excellent rooms. Very clean and well kept. A breakfast is included and is a very good meal. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a great patio on top of the hotel that has a great view of the Vatican, a nice way to end the day with a glass of great Italian wine. Just about everything is walking distance and/or easy to get to via the subway. We ended up here based on a Rick Steve's recommendation from his book after a rental apartment reservation turned out to be really bad. We spent more on the hotel than we would have on the apartment, but the location and excellent accommodations and breakfast was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - Superior Staff, Accomodations and Location”
Reviews.Author: Rainmaker59
Reviews.Content: Our group of 9 family members, ranging in age from 16 to 75, booked 4 rooms and spent 8 nights starting December 23, 2011at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano. We chose this hotel due the value and to the proximity to the Vatican where we would be spending much time. Due to the duration of our stay, we were able to get a great feel for the hotel. The front desk staff of Irene, Nico and Fabiana are absolutely the best you will find anywhere. They are all extremely courteous, helpful and knowledgeable about most everything you would need to know for your stay in Rome. We miss them already! The hotel serves a very fine breakfast buffet of the highest quality. Again, the restaurant staff and food selection are both excellent. All 4 of our rooms were located on the 2nd floor. Three of our rooms faced either the side or rear of the hotel while one of our rooms was located on the Via Vaticano facing the Vatican Museum. While muted traffic noise was experienced in the other rooms, the room located on Via Vaticano was quite noisy with scooters buzzing up and down the street almost incessantly. We would recommend avoiding rooms facing the Vatican Museum unless you are not bothered by traffic noise or have an ample supply of Ambien. The trade-off with that room however, is that it was located closest to the router and therefore had the best Wi-Fi access. Wi-Fi in the other rooms was somewhat spotty. The rooms themselves were all clean and nicely furnished. Bathrooms are clean, contain blow dryers, towel warmers and 110v outlets. The beds have great, firm mattresses. The rooms also contain safes for storing valuables. All-in-all, we were very pleased with our selection of this hotel and would strongly recommend it to anyone spending time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: sandyboyles
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across from the Vatican and close to several great restaurants. The rooms are small (as in all Rome hotels) but nice. Very good breakfast. Hotel can book a car to and from airport - although it will be quite expensive if you have a very early flight. You might want to keep this in mind as you make your flight reservations. Otherwise, use the early car. It is worth the extra that it will cost.

Reviews.Title: “location, staff, and service all great”
Reviews.Author: arlenella
Reviews.Content: The location of his hotel was the reason I booked it, as my mother is elderly. The rooms and staff far exceeded my expectations. the hotel is literally steps from the vatican museum. I wish I could remember the name of the sweet woman at the front desk who was so helpful in pointing out a great and inexpensive restaurant around the block and shopping areas for us.

Reviews.Title: “Got to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mirleen
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast, I will definitely be back. Clean rooms, great view.

Reviews.Title: “At Vatican Museum and well run”
Reviews.Author: johnawc
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of proximity to the Vatican Museum (across the street) and now it is our preferred hotel in Rome. The rooms are very well appointed and quiet (quiet is important in Rome with all the motorcycles). Breakfast is substantial. Wifi is free in the room with good signal and speed. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Directly across from Vatican Museum entrance; friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bob H
Reviews.Content: Staff are very friendly and helpful. Good sized and very clean room for our family four. Breakfast is good quality and good selection of food. In good weather, roof terrace offers great views of the Vatican. Bar area is more "B&B" style - the front desk staff runs back to the bar to prepare the drinks. Warm, friendly service and you can take your drink to the room or roof terrace. Location is quiet and it's good for the Vatican (and worked well for our family), but not ideal if you want to be in the center of the prime sights of Rome. We booked the hotel's car service for our trip to the airport. Service was prompt, friendly and the car was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, handy location”
Reviews.Author: allan38
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed out time at the Alimandi. Very family friendly, good service and large clean rooms, although a bit basic. There are no other facilities at the hotel (no gym, spa etc.), which you might expect for a 4 star. Breakfast was a varied continental collection and never too busy. We found the eggs and bacon to be luke warm rather than hot (same everywhere in Italy) but there was a microwave to heat things up if required. There are plenty of restaurants nearby but try to get away from the Vatican area as they can be a bit touristy. There are 2 subway stops nearby also so it is very handy for getting around the rest of Rome. The hotel is right outside the Vatican Museum entrance, which is handy if you want to get there early. We found around 3pm was the quietest time to go - no queues, just walk right in.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time we have stayed here and looking forward to the next visit already!”
Reviews.Author: BMNS
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, personal service, very clean, fabulous breakfasts, great neighborhood, easy to get to sights but not caught up in the crowds. And if you are planning on a Vatican visit (we did not), it is at your doorstep! Stay here, you won't be sorry! BMNS New York City

Reviews.Title: “All roads lead to Rome and they all drive by the Alimandi!”
Reviews.Author: glamourchics2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break at the Alimandi Hotel in Rome. Stayed in a family room which included two comfortable large king beds and a stylish bathroom (good shower). The breakfast buffet was good but more continental style with scrambled eggs! Both reception and restaurant staff were pleasant and helpful. The location is great but at a price because the traffic noise is horrific. The children slept through it but I never slept a wink on the first night. I asked for another room but they all suffer from the same problem. I invested in a pair of good quality ear plugs the following day and managed to sleep thereafter. Great time of year to visit Rome and will definitely return one day, but maybe to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Alimandi Vaticano”
Reviews.Author: Judith K
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience at the Hotel Alimandi. I am very picky about cleanliness and this hotel was very neat and clean, from the guestrooms to the lobby to the breakfast area. Desk staff extremely helpful and friendly. Daily breakfast was fantastic, lots of choices and again, very clean. The Vatican Museum is directly acrosss the street which was a plus for us. Very safe neighborhood. Do not regreat a penny spent at this hotel, will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a wonderful mini-apartment!”
Reviews.Author: Lyn D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while in Rome and were in the B and B part of the hotel with a mini-apartment. We were thrilled to have a washer so we didn't have to hand wash laundry! There was also a fridge, a countertop oven, and 2 burners, as well as a thing to quickly make hot water. It was nice to have the extra amenities after 2 weeks on the road. Being near to the Vatican, things were a bit busy in the morning but very quiet in the evening. It was easy to make our pre-booked ticket time in the morning since we were right across the street from the entrance to the museum. One of the young women at the desk (didn't learn her name) who was on duty in the morning and early afternoon was especially helpful. When we would ask how to get somewhere via metro or bus, she would tell us the best way to get there. It was nice to have someone help us get around! We got to have breakfast in the main hotel, and it was very good. There was a huge selection of food and the pastries were particularly good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Shazza80
Reviews.Content: We had 6 nights at this hotel recently and would highly recommend it to travellers to Rome. The service by all members of staff was outstanding but special mention to Nico who was extremely helpful. Location is great and within walking distance to many good restaurants and tourist attractions. The rooms are spacious with free wifi. In addition the shuttle to and from the airport was a great benefit with immaculate vehicles. We would definitely stay here again next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 39Ken
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. I didn't realize how close it was to the entrance of the Vatican - making it extremely convenient. Very clean rooms, staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast included in the price was excellent. They offered a wide variety of fresh food - the entire stay exceeded our expectations. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Service, Cleanliness and Price”
Reviews.Author: Thomas T
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome Italy and were concerned about our lack of speaking the Italian language and concerned about what we were going to get for accommodations since we had never booked a hotel room on line let alone in a foreign country. The accommodations of this hotel, especially the service provided by the desk clerk Nico far exceeded our expectations even if this were a 5 star venue. The room was immaculate and ready for us before normal check in time allowing us to catch a short nap (jet lagged) before our first tour. The location of the hotel was also perfect for our tour of the Vatican the next day. Nico also did a great job of recommending restaurants and securing the services of Gregori who provided us with excellent limousine service to our cruise ship. This was a great start to our vacation and this is where we will stay when we return to Rome for additional sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you don't mind staying far from most attractions”
Reviews.Author: aff2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Alimandi, which is across the street from the Vatican. The hotel is great, and the location (fort he vatican) could not be better. However, if you would like to stay closer to all the major attractions, it might be a bit out of the way. We love walking, so we did not mind walking the streets of the Vatican and Rome. These were rather long walks, but very enjoyable. There are restaurants close to the hotel, and perhaps the bet ice-cream I had in Rome was walking distance to the hotel as well. I would stay in the Hotel Alimandi again. It is a great place. The one drawback we found was that we arrived in the hotel very early in the morning and they did not check us in until the afternoon. However, the hotel policy does mention that check in time is in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: Traveled with our two kids (6 and 3) - room had two queen beds. Spacious, clean, and comfortable. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Right next to Vatican but easy to walk or take a cab to anywhere else in the city. Have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick7p
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Alimandi for our wedding anniversary , asked for a nice room in hope more than expectation and was rewarded with room 303 , a gem , overlooking Vatican and with it's own private balcony ! Hotel was spotless and all staff very friendly especially Nicko on reception . Room great , sky , free wifi and lovely bathroom . Breakfast great as others had said but some bizarre offerings like broccoli and asparagus .....ask for the cappuccino .....perfect for Vatican but a little way from old Roman quarter ....also we'd requested private transfer which for 50 euro was great value with smart Mercedes and met at airport ....recommended.....just like the Alimandi !!

Reviews.Title: “So nice, we thought we were in Germany”
Reviews.Author: jpzeller
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here in early June 2011, and couldn't have been happier. The room (a family quad, really just a larger room with two very sizable beds) was fine, the air conditioning worked well, and there was plenty of hot water with good water pressure. We felt the hotel was set apart by its cleanliness and very solid, substantial construction and decor. Marle and wood are everywhere, and the hotel was easily as clean and well-maintained as any we have encountered on many trips to Germany. The shuttle service to and from FCO is indispensable: right on time, and comfortable. Of course, the location for visiting the Vatican can't be beat. We weren't wild about the breakfast, but that is just personal taste. The staff in the breakfast room were wonderful. Will definitely stay there on future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but be careful of the surrounding restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: We would definitely recommend this hotel; the location is fantastic, the family room was great, the staff are helpful and friendly. On our first night in Rome, we went to the Ternosecco on Via Andrea Doria which was recommended by a member of the hotel staff. However, we found Christina, the owner of the restaurant, very dishonest in her dealings with us; we were overcharged on nearly every item on the bill, food and drink in excess of our order was put on the table and an unpublished service charge was also levied. On the second night we sought out another restaurant, Piacere Molise on Via Candia - it was great, the owner was very welcoming and upright.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: baldharv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano in May for 2 nights. We wanted a hotel that was close to the Vatican Museum. This hotel was across the street from the enterance of the museum. The street that the hotel is on is quite busy and noisy, however with the sound proof windows through out the hotel, we heard nothing. Our room was small as expected for Europe, there was lots of closet and drawer space. The bathroom was modern, large and extremly clean. The free buffet breakfast was hugh and delicious, althought they did have a few items that were a little strange for breakfast, ie chicken wings. The staff were warm, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great find and brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Tonstok
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Alimandi in Rome twice. The first time we experience a great level of service. The staff are friendly, the rooms very clean and spacious and it is located just opposite the Vatican Museum entrance. The buffet breakfast is really impressive and genuinely has so much choice of good quality food that it is bewildering but in a nice way! We have always ran ahead and they negotiate a room price and will also pick you up from Fumicino. The second time we stayed the staff really came into their own. I was pickpocketted in the subway and lost money and my driving license. Because of the latter, we were unable to hire a car to continue the rest of our holiday to Umbria. In passing, we told the hotel staff and they could not do enough to assist us. They arranged telephone calls, sent faxes and e-mails etc. However, way beyond the call of duty, the owner of the hotel used some connections with a local car hire company to help us overcome the problem of no license and persuaded them to give me a car using the temporary cover document I had been sent from the UKDVLA (may own petitioning of all the firms just got a plain 'no way'). All was saved and thanks to this guy's basic concern and kindness. So, not only a great place and location but run by the type of people you hope you will meet in an emergency!! If you are looking for a place in Rome, look no further. its a great place.

Reviews.Title: “good value- good location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce5447
Reviews.Content: We found both the hotel and its staff to be most pleasing. It is located right across from the entrance to the Vatican Museum. It is also located close to a number of restaurants, a block from two different large grocery stores and of course St Peters and the Vatican as a whole. Breakfasts were a full line selection (that would be what you'd expect in the US). It has a spars but utilitarian roof patio. All in all, good location-nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: vickishaw
Reviews.Content: This was a very lovely hotel. The staff were helpful, friendly and pleasant. The rooms were beautiful with spacious bathrooms. The mattresses were very comfortable which made for a well needed good nights sleep! The hotel also arranged tours for us, and one of the tours to the Bourghese Gallery got cancelled. Nico went out of his way to arrange another tour for us at the Gallery on the same day but with a personal guide since no groups were available..... the personal guide was no additional expense for us! The Vatican is directly across the street from the hotel, so you can eat your breakfast (which was our favorite meal of the day) while watching the long lines form. The breakfast there was awesome, the best of anywhere we have traveled. Everything fresh, hot and lots of it.....the cappuccino was wonderful! The young woman that takes care of the dining room guests was extremely pleasant and efficient. This is a great hotel that I would definitely stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: ElaineFrench
Reviews.Content: We simply loved this little boutique hotel which is right across from the Vatican Museum. The rooms were very comfortable and equipped with mini frig. The complimentary breakfast met the requirements of travelers from many countries with varying tastes. They also had a complimentary PC that you were permitted to use. Please note that the two restaurants near this hotel are not open for dinner. Walk up one block, go left and you will come to an area where there are great restaurants to chose from

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Squared”
Reviews.Author: jmwpga
Reviews.Content: The Alimandi Group has 3 hostelries: (1) the 4 Star Alimandi Vaticano (AV) directly opposite the entrance to the Vatican Museum on Viale Vaticano, (2) another Alimandi Hotel 50 yards down the stairs off Viale Vaticano on Via Tunisia and (3) what they call the Alimandi B & B which is basically comprised of 3 rooms in an apartment building in back of AV with its own entrance. The B & B shares AV's services including the front desk, internet and the very attractive restaurant next to the front lobby. We stayed in the B & B for the first 4 days, went to Venice for 3 days and then stayed in AV for 2 nights before going on a 17 day cruise leaving from Rome (Civitavecchia port). Before describing our hotel experience, let me tell you that, 3 days before leaving for Rome from our home in Thailand, my wife had a boil/cyst lanced (yes, you can guess where it was) which required daily cleansing, disinfecting and bandaging for at least 7 days; 4 of which would be in Rome. I contacted the Alimandi and described our situation to a lovely and extremely helpful young woman, Irene. Irene said we would have a great deal of difficulty getting help at any hospital in Rome and even a doctor might be difficult and certainly very expensive. Through her contacts, Irene sourced a highly recommended professional nurse who would come to the hotel each day as necessary. This turned out to be the perfect solution and we are extremely grateful to Irene. In fact, all people on the staff were very helpful with our questions and requests for information. Even one of the owners helped me when I had difficulty with the European type room key. The B & B was renovated and changed from an apartment to 3 hotel rooms which share a private common hallway. Two of the rooms have a private bathroom (with a lock and key) in this hallway. This is not my usual mode of travel but it was fine and, for 110 Euros per night, was among the lowest I've seen. Added to that, we did not run into our neighbors in our skivvies during the night. As I said, the last 2 nights were spent in Alimandi Vaticano and the room, while small, was lovely and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was especially nice and modern. According to the staff, AV was converted from a police station to this fine hotel in 2005 and that accounts for the immaculate conditions. Best of all was the included breakfast in the beautifully decorated lobby restaurant which looks out to the Vatican walls. The buffet style breakfast was superb with a wide variety of eggs, cheeses, meats, pastries, etc and some delicious fresh baked cakes and cookies. I'm sure this is comparable to the best breakfasts in Italy and decidedly better than our higher priced hotel in Venice which offered donuts, cold cereals and little else. There was a young woman (I apologize for not remembering her name) working in the restaurant, a Polish immigrant, who serviced the restaurant and the tables and was an extremely pleasant person. The other servicers when they were on duty were not half as efficient or as hard working as she. She is a credit to the Alimandi. The Alimandi has a great location next to the Vatican Museum and there are taxis always available at this location. We took the Metro for most of touring days except one day when the entire government went strike---apparently, a regular occurence but we were told this was a big one. The Metro is a pleasant 10-15 from the hotel. All-in-all, our experience was the best and we especially thank Irene who turned a potentially disastrous several days into a great tourist experience. Many thanks, Irene!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've found in Rome - Class, comfort, convenience”
Reviews.Author: Sensitivity
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, nonsmoking, comfortable beds, all the modern conveniences. Best breakfast boufet with many choices for all travelers. There are rooftop terraces available to relax after a hard day's touring. Restaurants, gelato, bars and cafes all nearby. The Vatican Museum (reportedly the second largest museum in the world) is across the street. Rome is at the doorstep for easy exploration by foot, taxi, bus and metro. The desk personnel were very helpful and provided convenient transfers to and from the airport for us for a minimal fee. Be sure to walk the backstreets with real Romans and enjoy the little shops just a block or so away.

Reviews.Title: “We feel right at home at the Alimandi Vaticano!”
Reviews.Author: homebrewer01
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at this wonderful family run hotel in Rome. My wife and I came to pick up our daughter from a semester abroad in Firenze and we made it a family holiday. We can't thank all of the staff--including Nico and Irena--enough for answering any questions we had, making dinner reservations, and just ensuring that what we needed to coordinate mutiple arrivals during the Easter holiday. The thoughtfulness and kindness you extend to us each stay means so much to us--and we do look forward to coming back to Rome and staying with you again. We have recommended this hotel to our frinds and work colleagues as an outstanding place to stay in Rome. Our thanks again for making our stay memorable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, recently re-furnished B&B”
Reviews.Author: Uschi9
Reviews.Content: Right next to Vatican City. We stayed in the bed & breakfast which is affiliated with the hotel. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this hotel - terrific overall!”
Reviews.Author: mipal7
Reviews.Content: Believe all the reviews about Hotel Alimandi Vaticano. It's a beautiful hotel located right across the street from the Vatican Museums. The rooms are impeccable, beautifully furnished and decorated, with plush, comfy beds, large bathrooms and open rooms. The staff were extremely helpful with every detail we needed including inexpensive private shuttle service to and from the airports (via Mercedes chauffered cars). The breakfast buffet was terrific as well! Great selection of food and the wait staff were friendly and helpful - so much so that our "guy" remembered our morning drink orders and had them ready for us each time we came in! The location of the hotel is also central to the metro, local shopping areas, the Vatican and St. Peter's, and is ideal for a stay in Rome. Again, the front desk staff are there to help you get around and are more than happy to recommend places to visit and eat. It's in a safe area with friendly people, with day and nightlife happening all around (but not noisy). Highly recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: McAuley2007
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome and so glad we booked the Alimandi Vaticano! I was with my mum and dad so the hotel courtesy shuttle to and from the airport saved so much hassle and worry especially when visting a city for the first time. Location wise in terms of the Vatican and St Peters Square, we could not have been closer. The breakfast every morning (which was part of our package) was fresh, tasty and the seating area was very clean and well maintained. The staff were all very friendly and helpful which truly makes a big difference to your stay in any hotel. The room was spacious and again very clean with a large bathroom. If you are visting Rome and specifically want to take in the Vatican and nearby attractions I would not hesitate to recommend the Alimandi Vaticano. One word of advice would be to NOT sit down and eat in the Vaticano cafe a few doors down as we were charged 52 Euro for 2 baguettes, a slice of pizza and 3 cokes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Crisps7
Reviews.Content: My family and I (including a nine-year old, seven-year old and my mother-in-law) have just returned from a three stay at the Alimandi Vaticano. We couldn't recommend the hotel enough. The rooms were lovely and the location brilliant. Just 5 minute walk from St Peter's square and across the road from the Vatican museum. The staff were extremely helpful giving us plenty of helpful advice. Would love to return to Rome in the near future and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for taking care of us--again!”
Reviews.Author: homebrewer01
Reviews.Content: My wife and daughter stayed overnight before traveling to Florence to drop my daughter off for a semester abroad at SACI; an art school. This is the 3rd time our family has stayed at the Alimandi and wife and daughter rec'd the same outstanding service as before. We truly appreciate your hospitality and the attention to detail in helping us make the most of our travel needs. The extra care and help you provided us in making travel reservations in April when the we come as a family to pick up our daughter when her semester has been completed also meant so very much to us. We have told our friends and colleagues about this wonderful hotel in Rome, and will continue to recommend you in the future. Thank you so very much for all that everyone does to make us feel at home. Our best wishes to all of you on the staff. We look forward to seeing you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: STNR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi at the begining of our vacation because of its location to the Vatican. We had no idea how close we really were until we looked out our window and actually saw the people lining up to get into the Vatican museum. There were 4 of us traveling, 2 adults 2 teenagers and the room worked out perfect. The room was clean and the bathroom was nice. We had internet and it worked perfect. The best part of the hotel I would have to say is the staff and the breakfast. The egg tart the chef made one day was to die for, but the selection of food was perfect especially with 2 picky teenagers. I arranged ahead of time to have the hotel pick us up at the airport since we were arriving after 7pm and their guy was there with a sign as soon as we walked out of baggage claim. He got the car within minutes and we were off to the hotel. Again on the way back to the airport we did the same and they were prompt and took us back with no issues at all. That right there made our trip that much nicer. The girl at the desk (I wish I could remember her name) told us a walking path to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain that gave us a chance to really see Rome. It was a long way, but we would have never seen what we did if we jumped on the train. All in all we had a great experience and would 100% recommend this hotel to those looking and if we have the chance to return we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Americans Looking to be Near Vatican”
Reviews.Author: MattyJJ
Reviews.Content: If you are an American tourist who wants to be near the Vatican and St. Peter's Church, then the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano is the place you want to be. It is located right across the street from the entrance to the Vatican Museum and is less than a 10-minute walk to St. Peter's and Vatican Square. My wife and I stayed there for the third time when visiting Rome for Christmas. The rooms are comfortable, clean and affordable. The breakfast was great. During our visit, we've always come across fellow American travelers. Most notably, the service is outstanding. Nico (who's been there for all our of three visits) and the rest staff was able to answer all of our questions and give us suggestions about the city, including great recommendations for nearby restaurants. In sum, this is a hotel that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: DSnyder777
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on Oct @8th - Oct 31st. Great breakfast buffet. Wonderful room. Amazing staff. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: HWBLONDE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi Vaticano for 5 nights while in Rome. Although a little pricey, the rooms were large, beds comfy and the bathroom very clean. Their breakfast was the best I have ever had. So many choices and very tasty. This hotel is right across the street from the entrance to the Vatican Museum. A very convenient location for walking all over the city. The rooftop terrace was a lovely place to sit out and drink wine in the evening. We enjoyed this hotel very much and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We are third time return clients to this hotel - that should say it all!”
Reviews.Author: BMNS
Reviews.Content: We fell into this hotel many years ago on one of our trips to Rome. We loved it instantly and knew that when we returned, which we did 2 x more, and hopefully will again, that this is "our place." It is a family run boutique hotel with the friendliest, most helpful people, great rooms and incredible breakfasts. Thanks to Irene who went beyond the call of duty in so many ways - talk about customer service, she is warm, helpful and knows what needs to be known! B & D New York, NY

Reviews.Title: “I surely fell in Love”
Reviews.Author: bnqn49
Reviews.Content: I loved the Alimandi. Everyone was soooo very nice and helpful always. The breakfasts were fabulous and includedmin the price. We are planning another trip to Rome next yearand because of its' cleanliness and central location we definitely will stay at the Alimandi again

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality and location for stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tedmar47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for 5 days. Highly recommended. Location very good: just a few steps to the entrance of the Vacitan Museums. And from there you can easily walk into the city center. Rooms were large, very well kept and comfortable. Breakfast was outstanding with a fine combination of cold and hot items. Staff very friendly and helpful. Lots of "ristorantes" and "pizzerias" in the neighborhood. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: stephie75
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the great customer service of the concierge/front desk personnel of the Hotel especially Irene. We checked in at 11pm due to flight delays and all the restaurants within close walking distance from the hotel were closed already so Irene helped us order a pizza and got it delivered to our room. The next day she went out of her way and helped us book a 3 hr chauffeur driven guided minivan tour of the main sites of Rome. it was a Sunday and a public holiday so a few places she called were already booked but she found someone who could do it also at a time we preferred.Mauro spoke excellent English and was not just a mere chauffeur but excellent tourguide as well. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was great, we could see the queues forming for the Vatican Museum outside. We booked a quad family for the 4 of us and it was spacious even with 2 big double beds in the room and ceiling high enough that we didnt feel cramped in. Room was clean and bathroom modern and spacious. Our one complain was the air-conditioning couldnt be better regulated and we were too cold ! We booked a 3 hour tour of the Vatican Museum which included St Paul's Basilica with Presto Tours and the meeting point of the tour was conveniently right next to the Alimandi hotel so the 8.30am start wasnt a problem at all. Thanks again to Irene, she gave a great personal touch to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Andy6466
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after a nightmare taxi ride from the airport,(Ciampino). Warning! make sure you agree the price before you set off as we were charged 60 Euros and would have been left on the side of the road if we had not paid. The hotel reception was cool light and airey and the girl behind the counter was very helpful. Our room was on the second floor and overlooked the entrance to the Vatican. The room was spotless and the air conditioning brilliant. Breakfast was buffet stlye and included hot and cold dishes with plenty of choice. The hotel was ideally placed for all the sights and a few hundred metres from the tour bus stop. There are plenty of restaurants nearby but more value and better food can be found if you take one of the many side streets near the hotel. We booked a airport shuttle for our return journey for 50 euros from reception and were taken back in a top of the range Mercedes. My son was even car sick on the way back but the driver was lovely even offering to pull over if needed. Only one downside of the hotel was the male receptionist was not as helpfull as the two girls. One the whole a brilliant Hotel which we will use again in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: mficke0713
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome and so much better than our first. Our first trip the hotel cost us $600 a night and really wasn't worth it ,although we were within walking distance of everything. I found this hotel on Tripadvisor after a lot of research and I'm so glad I did as it turned out to be perfect. We stayed 2 nights before a cruise in November and 1 night after the cruise. Communication with the hotel via e-mail through their website went without any problems---they always answered the e-mails very promptly. After a phone call from the airport they picked us up---at the time it only cost 5 euros a person. We arrived early, but breakfast is not included on the first day---but the front desk sent up coffee and cookies to our room. This is a non-smoking hotel, and both my husband and myself are smokers, but we were given a room with a private patio that had a table and chairs with a view of the Vatican entrance where we were allowed to smoke, so it worked out perfect for us. The first room we had was very large and had a seperate sitting area and a king sized bed. The room we had after the cruise had 2 queen sized beds and once again a private patio. The staff were very friendly and knowedgeable and gave us very good recommendations for dinner. The breakfast in the morning was very good with a large variety of food. We took a tour bus near St. Peter's Square for 10 euros each that allowed us to get on and off at different destinations for a 24 hour period, so we were still able to see a lot of the major attractions. We hired a shuttle to take us to and from the port and this turned out very well also. All in all, we loved this hotel and the next time we go to Rome, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient if Vatican your only destination”
Reviews.Author: jduganmitzy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, although I think it was a little overpriced for the combination of location and quality of rooms. If you are only visiting the Vatican while in Rome, this is the place for you, however. The door to the Museum can be seen from the door of this hotel. Otherwise, it is much too far out of the way to enjoy the city easily. You have to spend too much time going back and forth on metros, or in my case when I had to take a taxi back to the hotel, a fortune in taxis. We were here 3 days at the beginning of our trip and were scheduled to be here the last day, but when I saw how far out of the way it was, I changed the booking for the last day. In the hotel's defense, it was probably my fault for not researching the location better - someone recommended it and booked it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: carolsphc
Reviews.Content: Choice was made from Rick Steve's book. Located across from the Vatican. Very clean and good size double room. Staff very helpful and willing to give suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Urania289
Reviews.Content: Charmed by the location and service in this lovely hotel just one step from Vatican City!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly presented and positioned.”
Reviews.Author: Bassoues39
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with pleasant and helpful staff at hand. Pecfectly positioned for the Vatican. Top tip - Book a guided tour of the Vatican and relax in the restaurant, enjoying the superb buffett breakfast as the queues form outside. Then walk around the corner and then straight into the Vatican with a tour guide - perfect. The Hotel provides a shuttle service to and from the airport - again, well worth the 10 euros person. It all makes for a hassle free arrival to Rome. Once the Vatican has been explored, the Metro has 2 stops, both less than a mile away. This will take you into the heart of Rome and the other splendid sights on offer. Final Top Tip - visit the Old Bridge Ice Cream shop opposite the Vatican wall and about half a mile from the hotel, towards the Castel St D' Angelo [ Not the one immediately next to the Hotel - rip off ]. Enormous ice creams for just 2 euros and a popular meeting place for all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Value”
Reviews.Author: pent3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great from start to finish! I arranged the hotel to pick us up at the airport, which only costs 10 euros a person! The driver was there just after you clear customs, with a sign with our name. The staff was great, they allowed us to check in very early, which was great because we flew all night. Also, the staff was very helpful with any questions we had. The breakfast was the best hotel breakfast I've had in Europe. To top it off, the location was great! I would recommend to pre-pay and save yourself some money.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service eclipses everything else”
Reviews.Author: Intl_trvler
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel -- my sister highly recommended it, and it has such great reviews on Trip Advisor. I'll start with the positives. It is, as others have noted, a conveniently located hotel across from the Vatican museum. The rooms are relatively clean. The breakfast is OK. They have a computer for guests' use, which is convenient. Rooms are a good size when compared to other hotels in historical buildings. Unfortunately the service was pretty poor, and we didn't have major requests or demands. Every other hotel (of 5) we stayed in in Italy had great service, so I know it is not standard for hotel employees to be rude. After an indifferent reception and no offer for anyone to take our bags (not a huge deal, but odd since this had been offered at all three of the other small inns/B&Bs/boutique hotels we stayed at) we had to ask the front desk four times over several hours to please shut off the heat to our room. The front desk guy insisted that there was "nothing wrong" with the temperature in our room but if he had actually once taken the time to come to the room (or asked someone else to) he would have realized he was wrong far before the fourth request, when he finally turned it off. (The room was still extremely hot and we didn't sleep very well). The woman in the breakfast room kept asking if we were done before we had finished our meal, and rolled her eyes at me when I politely asked for a second cappuccino. The girl at the front desk was equally rude when we asked (again, politely!) if we could have some extra time checking out of our room. It's OK to say "I'm sorry our hotel is full"; it is NOT ok to bark "half hour. Maximum!" The hotel is also on a busy street so it's very noisy, even in our room that was on the opposite side. We stayed at two other hotels also conviently located in Prati that were much quieter. We needed to stay one extra night in Rome because of the volcano issue. We would have loved to stay in the same place to see more of Rome rather than take the time to schlep our luggage to another hotel -- but we just couldn't bear being in this negative place one more minute. There are plenty of lovely hotels in Rome with excellent service (and frankly better decor) for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: kilcrow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Alimandi last easter. I was really worried about booking a good hotel as we had never been to Rome before. I read reviews for this hotel and was really impressed by the comments. I wasn't disappointed. As I have kids and I'm really fussy anyway I expect cleanliness and comfort as a main factor in any hotel stay. The location was amazing, you can literally watch the queue for the vatican grow as you eat breakfast! We had a wonderful day visiting the vatican and literally walked (exhausted) around the corner back to our hotel. The rooms are not luxurious but clean and well equiped Staff were just lovely and very accomodating We liked to sit in the lobby after a day sightseeing and have coffee and biscuits! There is a very nice roof terrace for smokers. All in all this hotel is really lovely, everything is close by, a short walk takes you to all the buses you can get just about anywhere in the city. I intend to go back with family again and would without hesitation recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandrawatson
Reviews.Content: This is a well kept hotel. The beds,bathrooms,towels were all excellent and the whole hotel is immaculate. The decor is lovely and the pictures on the walls by an italian artist ( I think called Tamburrino) are fantastic. The staff are very polite and friendly and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Vatican City.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds in Italy”
Reviews.Author: pudeljumpr
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Italy, traveling with my husband and sister in law. After 2 weeks of traveling and staying in some very nice hotels throughout Italy, we spent our last 2 nights here before returning to the U.S. What a welcome relief! Although we had stayed at nice and highly rated hotels during our 2 weeks, every hotel we had stayed at seemed to have old, thin, saggy, and terribly uncomfortable mattresses. When we finally arrived at Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, we were elated to find firm, comfortable beds with lovely linens. The rooms were spacious, the bathrooms modern and attractive, the television was flat panel. Robes and slippers were provided. The breakfast buffet had the largest selection I have seen in any Italian hotel to date. The food was excellent. The windows of the breakfast area look directly across the street to the entrance to the Vatican Museums. A great location if you want to get in line before all the tour groups arrive in the morning. While this hotel was expensive, it was worth the good nights sleep and ammenities that were comparable to some better American hotels.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL TO SEE THE VATICAN”
Reviews.Author: TMAGNUM
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for Christmas. Hotel Alimandi Vaticano is an excellent hotel directly across from the Vatican museum entrance and about 10 minute walk to St Peters Square. Nice neighborhood with some good restaurants - front desk gave us recommendations and all turned out well. Metro stop about a 10 minute walk. Rooms are a bit small but very clean and nicely furnished. Our room was off the main road which was kind of noisy but not at night. I arranged for the shuttle to pick us up at the airport at 10 am. Our flight arrived around 8:30 and the driver was there waiting for us. Only 5 Euro per person definitely worth it. Breakfast buffet was served each morning and has a good mix of hot and cold foods. They will also arrange tours to Florence, Pompeii if you so desire. Only negative was cost-over $300 per night.

Reviews.Title: “classy hotel with very enjoyable rooftop breakfast,friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sailor1222
Reviews.Content: On our honeymoon, my husband and I stayed 3 nights here, a stone's throw from the Vatican Museums and about a 15-minute walk to St. Peter's Square. Hotel was very comfortable, staff was friendly and very helpful with directions, transportation suggestions and sold us the convenient Roma Pass. Although the rooms were on the small side, they were very comfortable, clean and ours was on the third floor which was one floor down from where breakfast was served on the rooftop. Breakfast was one of the highlights in our day. It was a full breakfast with everything from capuccino to eggs and sausage and for the healthy-eater, yogurt and fruit was served. Federico, the head chef for breakfast was very friendly and accomodating and always had a friendly greeting for us. We looked out over the rooftops of Rome. Although the hotel is located a bit away from the center of Rome, there are bus stops nearby and also the metro. So, a bus ride into the center of Rome is a great way to see the city. Don't forget to stamp your bus ticket once inside the bus !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_Cruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights prior to leaving on a cruise. The hotel was nice and it was certainly convenient for visiting the Vatican. However, we had several problems with the service. Well before our stay we had booked the complimentary airport shuttle. We received an email confirming our shuttle reservation and asking us to call their number when we arrived for instructions on how to find the shuttle. Well, we arrived and phoned and were told that there was no booking for us for the shuttle. So, we paid 30 Euros for the regular airport shuttle. When we arrived at the hotel and showed them the email, the attitude was "too bad!". I've noticed other reviews that said the shuttle service was fine, so our experience may have just been an anomaly. Also, when we booked the room, the Web price was 160 Euros. Our booking confirmation came back at 175 Euros. We wrote back and they sent a new confirmation for 160 Euros. The Alimandi is actually 3 hotels - a B&B, a 3 star and a 4 star. We had booked the 3 star (on Via Tunisi). When we arrived to check in, the 3 star was overbooked and they had moved us to the 4 star (on Viale Vaticano, just across the street). They said that they would honour our 3 star rate of 175 Euros. Out with the email and they agreed that it should be 160 Euros. When we checked out 3 days later, the rate was 175 Euros. Out with the email again, but they said "It's the higher rate because you were upgraded". Rather than argue, we paid the higher rate. My final problem was with the wi-fi in the rooms. I had my laptop and was given a password for the network. I fiddled around for quite a while and could not connect. The day staff were of no use in solving this problem, only stating that my laptop was at fault. The night guy was more helpful and told me that a number of guests were having problems connecting (ie. no one could connect). Why didn't they tell me that in the first place! Anyway, he lent me an ethernet cable and that worked just fine. On the plus side the rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were very nice and the double glazed windows were amazing. Our room overlooked Viale Vaticano - a very busy street. With the windows open, the traffic noise was unbearable. However, with the windows closed, it was very quiet. Also, we like a cool bedroom and the air conditioning was great. The included breakfast was very good with lots of choices. I would recommend this hotel, but would also mentioned what to look out for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlie49
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in Rome for a day before and after our cruise based on reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The location is perfect for anyone wishing to see the Vatican Museum and St. Peter's. It is literally steps away from the entrance to the Vatican Museum. The staff were exceptional. They were friendly and efficient. The shuttle service we had to and from the airport as well as the shuttle service to/from the pier in Civitavecchia was not only flawless but also a terrific value The driver was always on time. As we walked out of the terminal at the end of our cruise our driver was right there waiting for us which we truly appreciated. Our room was great with a modern bright bathroom. The breakfast was terrific with a lot of choices. The day we were leaving for home we had to leave for the airport before breakfast was being served but they provided us with coffee and some breakfast snacks. Compliments and appreciation to the staff at the Alimandi Vaticano for providing us with a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: FTLCruisers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days pre-cruise at Hotel Alimandi Vaticano and had a nice spacious room with free internet service. The location across from the Vatican Museum was great - lots of restaurants in the area and we always felt safe walking no matter what time of day or night we were out. The staff was always very helpful and courteous. They had a good selection of breakfast items on their buffet. I'd highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “3 Happy Tourist”
Reviews.Author: 3HappyTourist
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alimandi was great !!! The location was right on the wall of the Vatican and close to the underground transit... which could go anywhere if needed....so we saw alot ! Our window with view looked on the Vatican Museum entrance. The complimentry breakfast was beautifully presented, linin table clothes, warming trays & refigeration cases, all you could eat and plenty of variety. The staff was the best !!!! Maria at the Front Desk was always there and happy to help .... she had good advice & directions for sites to see, restuarants and even telephoned for our Museum reservations. They have a shuttle to the airport & right on time. We enjoyed many complimentary perks , which they included. My husband, myself and our grown Son were most pleased in every way and HIGHLY recommend Hotel Alimandi.... Thank You !!! Lisa of Huntington Beach California

Reviews.Title: “The friendliest staff I have encountered”
Reviews.Author: lmpieper_123
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth trip to Italy and have been on tour three of those times. This was the friendliest staff that I have encountered. They never seemed in a hurry to get you out of the way and were kind to those who do not speak Italian. The hotel is right across from the Vatican Museum. I would stay there again in minute. I would not call it the quietest hotel, as there seem to be a lot of family groups and groups of young people. But we enjoyed it immensely. AND the breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Service and cheap prices!!”
Reviews.Author: basegrl
Reviews.Content: My sister and I (both in our 40's) chose this B&B based on location, reviews of thier sister hotel and price. We were not disappointed!! You get to use the services of the 4 star sister hotel, but only pay the B&B prices. It's fantastic. Located right across the street from the Vatican Museum (you can't get any closer!) A wonderful full breakfast is INCLUDED in your stay. Pick up or delivery to/from the Airport at a cost of 5 euro per person, added to your bill. No need to hassle with public transportation when you get off long flight. The staff is very friendly, accomodating and willing to answer all questions. They all speak very good English. Recommendations were made for a restaurant and it was super. A little bistro with AMAZING Italian food, not some tourist stop. The rooms for the B&B are located in a seperate building (around the corner) from the 4 star hotel. They give you a key to the building, the room and the bathroom. Yes the bathroom is located across the hall from your room, but it is only accessable to you. It is not shared. While I would not want to have this set-up for my entire trip, having a non-shared bathroom across the hall was acceptable because of the price and the location. Everything was VERY clean. Room had airconditioning, which worked well. There was one bed, which looked to be a Queen size. It was comfortable. There was also a TV, alarm clock and closet space. There was even free Internet access. They say it only works in the lobby, but we were able to pick up the wireless signal in our room. I really enjoyed the mosic tile flooring and the large windows which overlooked a quiet street. The breakfast in the morning included eggs, bacon, cereal, pastries, fruit, cheese, bread, juices coffee, etc. We asked for a Cafe Latte which the wait staff made and brought to us. The hotel seemed to have mostly American and German tourists, in their mid 30's to mid 50's. It was a lovely place to start our vacation. As two ladies traveling on our own, we always felt safe and comfortable. We paid 90 euro plus 10 euro for the airport transportation, a fantastic price for what you get. If you are on a budget, but want GREAT service, GREAT location, and GREAT breakfasts, please consider this place. It really exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected- BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: ILOVURUP
Reviews.Content: Hotel arranged for shuttle bus to pick us up from Ciampino airport- very nice. Cost 60 euros total for the 6 of us- very worth it. Then on arrival we learned our B&B wasn't going to be the one featured on the web site. At first we thought they were baiting and switching - but we were wrong. Fortunately we didn't freak out, because the apartment we got was as good or better. Rooms clean, but not real fancy. Normal Rome apartment living. Nice bathrooms, fridge. Right across from their hotel - so breakfast was easy. They gave our family of 6 two rooms/two baths - which was nice. Free wireless wi-fi from the hotel was great- plus there was a computer at the hotel if you needed it- with printer. But the real gem was the service Paolo Alimandi gave us (yes this hotel system is truly family run) He offered to get our tickets for the papal audience from across town, washed all our clothes (twice) and never charged us, gave us excellent restaurant recommendations, and got us special tickets for a papal event at St Paul's Outside the Walls where we got within 40 feet of the pope- great pictures! Several restaurants we went to on his recommendation gave us special treats, free ice cream, etc. since we came on Paolo's recommendation. Location was great near the Vatican museums. Near a big city market too- which was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Anaknilinda
Reviews.Content: We loved the little hotel near the Vatican, literally across the street from the entrance to the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel. You don't have to wake up too early to line up for tickets since you are a few hundred feet away from the entrance! The lines get super long and in the hot sun, it is not fun! The size of the room was perfect for our needs. The ambience is great, very nice finishing, very elegant, very clean. We were told that we got the biggest room in the hotel with the balcony because there were 4 of us. It had 2 queen beds and one bathroom. The balcony looked out onto the street and we could see the gate to the Vatican Museum. Even if it was in a busy street, the windows were all double-paned hence it was very quiet at night. I loved our room! The breakfast buffet is great. The coffee, croissants, pastries, hot dishes were fantastic and the staff in the dining room, was extremely friendly and consistently hospitable. We were greeted with a smile every morning. We loved the location because we wanted to spend a lot of time at the Vatican. We went to St. Peter's Basilica for Vespers then Mass on Sunday evening. We also went for the Angelus and Papal blessing at noon. On Wednesday morning, we went for the Papal audience and we were right there. We could go back to our hotel midday to rest and cool ourselves since it was very hot (July). The ice machine beside the elevator is a brilliant idea and convenient for all the guests. There is a very popular gelato place on the way to St. Peter's Basilica. There were always long lines! It is called Old Bridge Gelateria (delicious gelato) and a small, non-descript Creperia beside it (same owner), with great crepes and it was an economical dinner option! The only downside to this hotel was the staff at the Reception Desk. The personnel did not seem happy to work there. They did not go out of their way to try to help us with information or make reservations for restaurants. I don't know what the problem was but something was not right. We stayed for a week and on the 5th day, our room was not made up and it was 3pm! That was not acceptable! If only the reception staff was more friendly and helpful, I would recommend this hotel wholeheartedly and give it a 5-star rating. The 4-star rating I give them is for the quality of the room, the breakfast, dining room staff and location. They have a great boutique hotel but the Reception staff seem unhappy! You know the expression "Aim to please"? We did not get this feeling at this hotel but we were out a lot so we just ignored it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: spotf15
Reviews.Content: Found on tripadvisor. As good as expected. Complimentary pickup at airport flawless. Very nice and helpful staff. Large room by American standards let alone European standards. Nicely appointed room. Free internet. Comfortable beds. Great complimentary hot breakfast buffet. Located directly across from Vatican Museum entrance. Vatican tour groups assemble on the steps right next to the hotel making you visit to the Vatican very easy. 5 minute walk to bus or train to get to all the other must see sites.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than in the reviews”
Reviews.Author: emabusybusy
Reviews.Content: We came with high hopes and were not disappointed. Everything was perfect - the hotel itself, spacious room, beautiful big and clean bathroom, unbeattable location and extremely helpful staff, even more than in 5 star hotels we've stayed in! Breakfaast was wonderful, with excellent coffee, not just the plain machine coffee, but selection of cappucinos, cafee lattes etc. Also, hotel has a private guarded garage which was very important to us. Our only regret is that we forgot to leave the tip for the staff - one more reason to come back!

Reviews.Title: “The best location you could wish for visiting Rome”
Reviews.Author: eric61
Reviews.Content: We stayed end of april in this Hotel. They have rooms for four persons. Two luxuryous kingsize double beds. A good length for long persons. Very clean rooms and helpfull staff, marvelous breakfast buffet, a treatment for the day. You can order a shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. It is adviseble to do so instead of taking the subway and train. One feature that amazed us was a cityplan that was given to us whenever you had a question of a specific site by the hotel frontoffice. A splendid location to start a citytrip and explore the ancient sites of Rome. Just opposit the entrance of the Vatican museum. You can see the queues of people waiting there.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: keenertraveller
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. Great service from the time we emailed to book the shuttle bus to the minute we checked out. Friendly staff, good rooms, excellent breakfast and good location for the Vatican and St. Peter's. Close to bus and metro stops so we could get across the river easily to the other main attractions. Reception booked tickets for us and gave us good advice when we asked for it. Would recommend it absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location to visit the Vatican / St Peters Square”
Reviews.Author: lissamarie
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean hotel. It is located right across the street from the Vatican Museum and within walking distance of St Peters. It's not really near any other of the main tourist attractions, and you'll need to travel by metro / subway to get to the other sights. It can be a bit noisy, I dont thinks the rooms are sound proofed and the hallways are not carpeted. The breakfast is good, and there was a good selection. This is a nice city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ew91texas
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Rome and for once, we picked the perfect hotel. Clean, spacious, and friendly helpful staff and wonderful breakfast to start our day off right. The hotel staff even recommended wonderful restaurants for dinner. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally-located, Great Hotel for American Tourists”
Reviews.Author: MattyJJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our second straight Christmas in Rome, and we would highly recommend the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano. It's centrally located to the Vatican and St. Peter's Square and was full of fellow American tourists. The rooms are clean, and the hearty breakfast was a nice bonus. Most of all, the staff was helpful. In particular, Nico was very knowledgeable about Rome, gave us excellent recommendations for dinner and helped us better understand the Italian culture. He also helped prevent one of the cabbies from ripping us off for an extra 20 euros on the taxi ride from Termini station to the hotel! Overall, a solid hotel that we would recommend to Americans traveling to the Eternal City. MJ Rockville, MD

Reviews.Title: “Alimandi = A plus”
Reviews.Author: Bix80
Reviews.Content: After 7 trips to Italy, staying at a total of 17 different hotels in 7 different cities, I can honestly say that Hotel Alimandi Vaticano ranks number 1. Excellent, accomodating service. Spacious and immaculately kept room. Amazingly varied breakfast buffet (where do all of those dishes come from ?). Vatican Museum is right across the street. Great recommendations on where to dine. Short walk from Cipro Metro Station,

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, Spacious and Spotless”
Reviews.Author: texastrekker66
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano in Rome earlier this month and would definitely stay there again, particularly if my focus were again on St. Peter's and the Vatican. The staff were all efficient and gracious. I am especially appreciative of how they handled my airport shuttle booking. I had arranged (via e-mail) for a 10:00AM airport shuttle pick-up, based on my flight's scheduled arrival time from New York -- figured I'd have at least an hour's wait, but didn't want to book an earlier shuttle and then miss it. Turns out that my flight arrived almost an hour early -- I called the hotel as soon as I cleared Customs, and they told me that the driver was outside, already waiting for me. They'd been monitoring my flight and sent the shuttle out early -- a much-appreciated kindness, especially on a cold and rainy day. My room was large, even by US standards -- two queen beds with plenty of room leftover, plus two large armoires and a patio overlooking the entrance to the Vatican Museums. The bathroom was also above-average in size, with all new fixtures kept spotlessly clean. Breakfast included a huge array of baked goods, an ample selection of eggs and meats, plus cereal and yogurts, tended to by attentive but low-key staff in a large and cheery breakfast room fronting the Museum entrance. Only one small negative -- the ice machine was on the same floor, two doors away from my room, and it was occasionally loud enough to interrupt this jet-lagged traveler's sleep. Suggest that it be relocated or enclosed. Otherwise, my stay at the Alimandi was just about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlueCorvette
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. We stayed there twice during our vacation and would stay there again. Germano, and the rest of the staff, gave easy walking directions to very nice and reasonable restaurants, and the entire staff always were trying to help us. This hotel is family run and it shows. The rooms were always very clean, the breakfast was more than expected and varied each day, and the staff were always friendly. The Hotel is directly across the street from the Vatican Museum and St. Peters. We had several tours organized by the hotel, all were excellent. Our driver Gionfranco was an outstanding driver, even in Rome traffic. I highly recommend this hotel if your stay in Rome has you going to St. Peters and the Vatican Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Debdesigner
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano was fabulous. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They made our trip to Italy a very memorable experience. We were treated with personal attention and care. I encourage anyone traveling to Rome to stay with this family run business. The breakfast was a great way to start our day of walking and seeing the sites. With map in hand and instructions from Sarah or Germano we were on our way! Our rooms were exceptionally clean and quiet. I would request a room off the street. It is more quiet. We also stayed at hotels in Venice and Florence which were 5 stars and Hotel Alimandi Vaticano was the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “The Alimondi is an Oustanding Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: homebrewer01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our reservations on line (and re-confirmed with a phone call) for November 13-22 2008. There is not an insurmountable language barrier--but in fairness to all parties, it behooves the traveler to take some responsibility and double check to ensure that there are no misunderstandings, which is why we just double checked with a phone call to ensure that our reservations via the internet had indeed been made. This was our first trip to Italy and we were a bit apprehensive about not only booking on line but also what would await us when we arrived--as this was for a belated 25th wedding anniversary trip. To say that we were pleasantly surprised is an understatement. Blood is thicker than water---and it is obvious that this is a family run operation--which results in good quality control! I cannot emphasize how kind, considerate and thoughtful the staff at the front desk and in the kitchen (who served us breakfast each morning) were to us. The rooms were clean and housekeeping did an outstanding job in making sure things were neat as a pin when we returned from a day of sightseeing. We rec'd great recommendations for loal restaurants---when we got up the courage to be adventuresome and eat out some distance away, Germano not only called a cab for us to get to the restaurant but came out and gave the cab driver instructons on where to take us---this is truly outstanding service for which we were very grateful! Francesca in the restaurant always welcomed us with a big smile and was especially helpful to my wife who has some special dietary needs (as were the kitchen staff behind the scenes). Maria and Eilena at the front desk were more than gracious and helpful.
