The only downside--not the fault of the hotel--is that the front street is very busy and there is some noise if you have a room in the front of the hotel facing the wall of the Vatican---but one gets used to it. Just make sure that you cross streets in the cross walks to avoid being dive bombed by motor scooters (ie, no jay walking!!). I have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Almondi Vaticano to friends and colleagues---and I will certainly want to book reservations there when I return to Rome again. Certainly, the experience that we had is a primary reason for wanting to return to the eternal city for a second excursion! Our best wishes and thanks to the staff at the hotel for making our stay and our anniversary celebration a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sudburytravelers
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in an excellent location across the street from the Vatican Museum and within walking distance of most major attractions. The rooms are very quiet and immaculately clean. The front-desk staff is friendly and very helpful with suggestions for restaurants and things to do. Breakfast fare is outstanding with eggs and bacon (perfectly cooked), pastries, cheeses, cereals, fruits, yogurts and cappuccinos. The staff will provide gluten-free options upon request. We stayed at this hotel in the Fall of 2006 and loved it then. At that time, the Alimandi Vaticano was one of the top-rated hotels on Trip Advisor. The hotel was just as good this time, and we will be sure to stay there again on our next trip to Rome. Based on our very positive experience, we do not understand why this excellent hotel has fallen in Trip Advisor's ratings. For us, this hotel remained an outstanding choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great - Would Highly recommend !”
Reviews.Author: carise1
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend in Rome with Husband. Stayed at the Alimandi Vaticano and can't rate it highly enough. Fantastic breakfasts - so much choice of hot and cold foods - polite and welcoming restaurant staff. Rooms so clean and very well equipped. Location great. Really made our trip to Rome unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up To Its Reputation”
Reviews.Author: Traveldog86
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the hotel and enjoyed the entire trip. We thought the hotel was excellent and the staff at the front desk was some of the best we have experienced anywhere. We would quickly stay here again on future trips. We had no problems with the reservation (although I would include the airport transfer in the reservation on future trips). We arrived before the noted check-in time and the staff graciously offered a room early. The room was spacious with a large bathroom. It contained all the modern conveniences that we expected and everything worked properly. Although located on a busy street, we had no problems with the outside noise at night. The location is more convenient for the Vatican than for some of the other tourist sites, but the transportation (Metro, bus, and taxi) was very convenient and allowed us to travel the entire city easily. The breakfast was above average with different cooked foods every day, plenty of fruit and cheese, many cereal and pastry choices, juices and different types of coffee. For a small hotel, we were very pleased. Also, the bar and roof garden were good places to reminisce about the day's activities. The staff at the front desk was able to handle all our requests -- from the best local places to eat, to how to obtain the desired tours, to how to travel to other locations in Italy. If they had free time, they were also willing to sit down and discuss Italian and American cultures or current events. This was a very nice, small hotel that catered to its clients!

Reviews.Title: “Just alright.”
Reviews.Author: uofabecca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alimendi Vaticano for four nights on our recent trip to Rome. After reading all the great reviews on Trip Advisor, I was pretty excited. The hotel did not live up to my expectations. It is located on a very busy street across from the Vatican Museums. The traffic could be heard clearly from our room. In addition to the that, the floors in the hallway are made of marble and every morning we were wakened not only by the traffic, but also the clicking of the maid's heels and other traveler's suitcases parading up and down the hallway. SUPER annoying. Breakfast was average. Bathrooms were tiny. No turn-down service. The one and only thing we were really impressed with was Nico, the front desk manager. He was so helpful and knowledgeable. I blew a fuse in our room, and he fixed it in less than 5 minutes even though he was the only one working at the time. He fixed a botched reservation for us, gave us tips on where to eat, and just went above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect start to our Italy vacation”
Reviews.Author: rivermeg
Reviews.Content: We booked the Almandi Vaticano after reading the review on trip advisor and using the hotel web site. It was easy and the staff responded to my e mails promptly. Inclusion of the airport transfer helped us get settled into Rome. The staff were always friendly, helpful, and gave us advice on getting around Rome and the sights. Our room overlooked the entrance to the Vatican Museum and while the street was crowded and noisy during the day, the crowds were gone at night and it was fairly quiet. Our room was perfect; it had a large bathroom and I enjoyed the ditty bag of toiletries. It was clean, modern, and everthing worked well. The room key also activated the electricity, an interesting energy saver and a source befuddlement for us as it took a few times to figue out that leaving the key in the slot keeps the current flowing! We took our evening cocktails on the roof garden; a pleasant way to review our day and think about where to go for dinner. We loved the buffet breakfast and the fantastic choices of hot and cold foods. The service was prompt and excellent. Yes, the Alimandi Vaticano is somewhat far from the city center but taxis and transit are readily available and we did not feel at all inhibited by distance. We would recommend the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano to anyone. It was an excellent value and the family who runs it are to be commended for its quality.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T BE FAULTED”
Reviews.Author: bluegirl22
Reviews.Content: We have just had a long weekend in Rome and can't praise enough the hotel and its staff. It is out of the centre and you must know this when you book, however if it was more central it would have cost us a lot more money (4 adults - 840 Euros for three nights). The hotel is very clean and towels are changed every day - not something that happens everywhere particularly in the USA. The breakfast buffet has enough choice to give you a good start on the day and the staff are very efficient at getting your coffee etc. We had a quad room with two large and comfortable double beds, it was clean and cool with good sound proofing and black out curtains. There is free wi fi in the lobby if you need it. The bar is open 24 hours and this made for a nice end to each evening with a rooftop drink. The prices are very reasonable as is the minibar. Central Rome is about a 30 minute stroll and the hop on hop off bus is only 10 minutes away and as the bus and metro are only a few steps away the location is perfect. There is a good choice of local restaurants and again as they are just out of the centre are very reasonably priced. Howeve we found that eating out in Rome is not expensive. The staff are very helpful and happy to give advice on what to do and how to do it. We would advise booking any tours (Vatican, Colleseum etc) with a "jump the line element" in them as the queues are very long. Another tip we picked up is to use your own water bottle and fill it from one of the many water fountains all over the city especially if you are visitng in the summer. We hope to return to Rome very soon and will definitely stay at the Alamandi Vaticano and can recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Way to Start a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ajhome
Reviews.Content: This was the starting point for our 18 day Italy-Greece cruise adventure. We decided to spend 3 days in Rome (8/1-3) before boarding and 2 days in Venice(8/16-17) after the cruise. I booked the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano based on the great reviews posted here. At the time I booked the reservation in January 08, it was ranked #1 on this site. Between the time of our booking and arrival (8 months), I noticed that because of a couple of sub-par reviews, it had lost its #1 ranking. I am a very experienced business traveler and we are very experienced vacationers, having traveled for business and pleasure all over the world. As far as we are concerned, Hotel Alimandi Vaticano will always be a #1 to us for the following reasons: 1) Hotel staff/service: It is still a family owned hotel with family members working as staff, and they take care of their guests like family members. They all speak English and are very friendly and knowledgeable about all aspects of what a tourist might want to know. In particular, they had great recommendations for restaurants. You always hear about how things in Italy never get done on time. This is not the case with the staff here. When they tell you they are going to take care of anything, it gets done on time and done properly, always with a smile. Prior to our arrival, I e-mailed them to re-confirm our reservations and heard back from them promptly. I also inquired about arranging for transportation to the port of Civitavecchia for us and heard back on that matter immediately with rates. 2) Location: As advertised, it is located directly across the street from the entrance to the Vatican museum. We took the express train in from the airport (very easy) and then tranferred to the Metro to exit within 6 blocks or so of the hotel (just be advised the subway station closest to the hotel does not have an escalator). With luggage, its a 15-20 minute walk from the Metro to the hotel max. Without luggage 5-10 minutes max. We used the Metro to get around to the Spanish Steps area, the Colosseum/Forum area with no problems. Other guests we ran into used the bus system which is also easily accessed from the hotel. If you need a cab, the hotel staff can get you one right away. Even though its not in the heart of Rome, its close enough so cab rides to areas like the Piazza Navona (great people watching at night) is around 10-12 Euros. The best part of the location is that its an area of the city which is only crowded with tourists during the day. At night, it reverts back to a regular neighborhood with nice local restaurants, town houses and apartments. 3) Room: We had a 3rd floor room looking right out at the Vatican Museum. With the windows closed there was almost no noise from the street during the day and as mentioned above, it gets very quiet at night once the Vatican shuts down. You hear about European rooms being cramped with no A/C all the time. It definately was not the case here. We had three twin beds for the three of us (me, my wife and 15 year old son). We all agreed that the beds were among the most comfortable we had ever slept on. There was a plasma screen TV with cable.The bathroom was huge even by american standards with new fixtures and a real shower stall (no bath-tub/shower combo). The A/C worked perfectly (We desperately needed it with 90F+ temps during the day and 80F+ temps in the evenings). An added bonus was a room safe where we could keep our passports and other valuables. There were also black out curtains which you appreciate when you have horrible jet lag (we traveled 18 hours straight from San Diego) 4) Hotel Facilities: Buffet breakfast (included with our room) as mentioned by other reviewers was really high quality with good variety. We never had a problem getting a seat and the wait staff was very prompt at seating you and getting coffee or tea for you. The lobby bar is small, but well stocked and the prices are very reasonable unlike most bars in American hotels. As mentioned by others, the roof top had tables and chairs and we finished each evening by picking up a glass of wine at the bar and heading up there to recap our day's travels. We had several nice conversations with other guests - English and American- up there. Everyone we spoke to had only good things to say about the hotel and staff. My son also found out he could get wi-fi access up on the roof (probably from one of the close by apartment buildings) for his I-touch. There is a pay-as-you-go internet terminal in the lobby, but I did not use it. 5) Special note for cruisers: You can take the train, a cab or a shuttle bus to get to the port of Civitavecchia which is about 1-1.5 hours north of Rome. I researched this as well and we decided to have the hotel arrange a shuttle for us, mostly to make it as hassle-free as possible. The shuttle picks you up at the hotel and drops you off right at your cruise ship. Here's the tip. For the 3 of us it was 150 Euros. The hotel shuttle is actually a mid-size Mercedes bus and can probably hold 20 people. The rate goes down the more people you have, so if you can I would see if there are others staying at the hotel who are also cruising and get them to join you. Also note, I researched the shuttle rates, and the rate on the hotel shuttle is competitive with other shuttle services. They are not trying to gouge you on this service. In all, staying at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano was a great way to start our vacation. Thanks to all the staff members at the hotel from your San Diego visitors!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Blown Away but Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: NapoleonLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights on the back of a recommendation from a friend. The hotel itself was good in that we had very good service from the front desk and the room was clean and comfortable. However to stay here, you have to commit to either 25 minutes walk to/from the old town or catching a subway each time to get in and out of the old town. Now Rome is a place where you want to walk around a lot to be fair, but we would have preferred walking new routes. Personally and because we went in the heat of August, I would have preferred staying somewhere more central where you can nip back to the hotel and go for a siesta so that you can continue to party at night or even just to freshen up before dinner. Also, the roof terrace is unused and has not atmosphere (no bar service). Room is comfortable but doesnt welcome you with that warm fuzzy feeling. Don't be fooled by the air-con control in the room as the air-con is controlled from the front desk! But really, it's not bad, just not great.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andy401C
Reviews.Content: Location - Perfect. If you've never been to Rome, you may be surprised at how small the main city area is (from the Hotel around the Vatican walls then on to the Spanish Steps down to the Colosseum and back through to Piazza Navona and then to the Hotel constitues a 'round-ish trip' and would take about 90 minutes if you chose to walk it in one go). This hotel is located across the road from the Vatican Museums in a nice quiet part of town. On arrival, one of the reception staff spent 30 minutes with us going over a map and suggestions for things to do - we stayed Mon-Fri which was plenty of time. The hop-on/hop-off bus tour was great and could be found 10 minutes from the hotel near St Peters. The hotel looked new - although it clearly isn't. Maintained to a very high standard with excellent rooms - bright/lots of marble, great beds (my family/kids stayed in a Quadruple Room which means there were two 5' beds which gave everyone more space. Every morning, it looked like a herd of buffalo on their way from a jumble sale had charged through it...but the maid sorted everything for us. I've read other reviews about the hotel breakfast but to be honest, didn't rate it. Served between 0730 and 1030 - if you arrived between 0930/1000, which we did a couple of times, there was very little left and it was luke warm/cold. Coffee and fruit were fine - just not something to really look forward to. Local traditional restaurant...turn left from the hotel, walk down the steps, across the first road and then right onto Via Candia - there is a fabulous place about 75 yeards down on the left with a huge Pizzeria sign in green hanging vertically - great meal there and seemed to be packed from 2000 onwards each evening. We also ate in the Hard Rock Cafe a couple of times - really good and definitely one of the better ones in the chain. The hotel shuttle was free on arrival (will collect from FCO at 0800 1000 1200 1400) but the service from hotel to airport stopped at 1300 - which meant a 50euro bill for a private transfer to the airport when we left as we had ean evening flight - no big deal, just something to be aware of. Overall, the hotel was spotless, very well kept with great staff, a nice roof terrace to grab a beer and relax on, and I'd absolutely recommend as a base to explore this fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault the Alimandi Vaticanio andi ts staff”
Reviews.Author: MikeStanley
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Rome and we were recommended to the Alimandi by the family we went with, who had stayed there last year. It was an absolutely fabulous hotel, and the staff could not possibly have been more helpful. It totally justified the 4 star rating as it was spotless throughout,, beautifullydecorated, excellent family room and bath room with all the trimmings. Fully air conditioned and the breakfast choice was extensive with the hot plate option varied slightly each day. The shuttle bus service to / from Fiumicono was an excellent added facility.We spent a couple of evenings on the 4th floor open terrace overlooking the walls / entrance to the Vatican museum - about 50 yards across the road so you can easily be at front of the queue for the Cistine Chapel if you set an alarm call. We have nothing but praise for this establishment and a couple of our friends are going next month on our strong recommendation. The Smiths, - Mum ,Dad and 2 x 16 year olds

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding all around”
Reviews.Author: CTMan1
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (two adults and 2 kids age 8 and 15) have had nothing but a superlative experience with the hotel and its very warm and personable staff. The owner's family started out by renting single rooms to students and it has evolved into an outstanding family run hotel. The room and bathroom ware immaculately cleaned and during the (very) hot Rome afternoon, it was a great relief returning to our room. Although it is near a busy area, we did not hear any ouside noise as some had mentioned. The location is excellent; accross the street from the Vatican Museums. Also 10 min. walk to St Peter; 5 min. walk to Metro and to ATM. (Must walk and stroll and take in life at Via Cola di Rienzo, 10 min. walk from Hotel). Alimandi Vaticano: Nothing but praise. Caloggero sei grande!!! Sicily was truly beautiful; we went to Syracuse, Taormina, Enna (what a view) and Piazza Armerina. Alla Prossima.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: welshshrew
Reviews.Content: Great stay at this hotel. Took at 45 euro taxi from the Ciampino airport directly here although public transport is cheaper with 3 of us and luggage we were happy enough. Location is wonderful across from Vatican and with decent restaurants near which were recommended by the ever helpful staff. Bus stop is just across the road for buses into the city, also metro station 10 mins walk then 10 mins direct to Spanish Steps. Always remember to establish price for taxis or that the meter will be running prior to taking a journey. 10 mins walk and a great cheap lunch dinner options is this place http://www.linsalataricca.it The hotel breakfast was superb, the room we stayed in fantastic, and so clean. As others have said, the roof terrace is a great place to relax after hussle and bussle of Rome and drinks prices at 3 euros a beer and 1 euro a soft drink are remarkable. If you want a 4 star slightly out of the hectic centre, but still in Rome and with all the benefits of public transport and the Vatican being next door, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shazza_h
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano for 4 nights during August. We had 2 rooms right next door to eachother. Asides from the location right opposite the Vatican Museaum, the best thing about the hotel is the service from the staff who were wonderful , knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. As previously mentioned by other reviews, the location is fab if you want to visit the Vatican museaum (best time to go is at 2pm when there are no lines!). The area is quiet at night and seems to be less touristy than others. We took a cab into the central shopping area for only 10 euros. The hotel also provides a shuttle - 4 times a day to and from Fuimicino airport. It is very easy to find the location of the shuttle upon arrival. The rooms are spotlessly clean and well furnished. Breakfast is included and is well stocked with the usual breakfast items as well as some Italian favourites. Dont bother with the restaurants to the left of the hotel - overpriced catering to the tourist foot traffic which the Vatican Museaum attracts. The hotel gave us excellent recommendations for meals within a 5 minute walk. We hired a tour guide for one day - Stefano from Romecabs and it was most certainly good value for money. Stefano is very knowledgeable about the area and a great guide for the day. It was lovely to see the sites then get back into an airconditioned car! Overall, a great stay at the Alimandi and we will be back if ever in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wjm_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Four star prices, but five star service and quality. My family stayed here for 3 nights prior to our cruise. The complementary shuttle service was a nice amenity. The rooms were VERY clean and large. The hotel staff was extremely helpful. The location was perfect for us. We loved having wine on the rooftop! I would certainly stay the the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at the Alimandi Vaticano”
Reviews.Author: mimi057
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and found it to be exactly as we expected from what was written on tripadvisor's site. It was our first hotel on our first trip to Italy and it made for a perfect start to a dream vacation. Directly across from the Vatican in a lovely part of town. An easy walk to St. Peter's square and the buses/metro. The breakfast buffet was excellent and provided many different hot and cold food choices. Service was friendly and efficient both in the restaurant and the staff spoke fluent English. Our quad room was spacious enough and immaculately kept with a lovely bathroom and airconditioning. There are plenty of reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance and lots of shops too. All in all a perfectly positive stay!

Reviews.Title: “loved the Alimandi Vaticano”
Reviews.Author: shellywelly123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Alimandi Vaticano for 1 night precruise and wish we could have stayed longer. I found the staff to be very helpful and freindly, from answering all my emails, to the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel, to storing our luggage while we were taking a tours. The rooms were clean and quiet. The bathroom was large and modern. We stayed in a quad room ( 2 queen beds) which is hard to find in Rome. The only thing that didn't seem to work was the tv, but we didn't have time to watch it anyway. The breakfast buffet was great (my husband can eat alot). The location for us was great across form the Vatican museums. It was an easy cab ride to the Colliseum the next day. We also roamed around piazza Navonna that one night. We would definately come back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...”
Reviews.Author: gmmcm
Reviews.Content: A brief review. The hotel was amazing. We booked another hotel and after one night left. My wife heard about this hotel in a travel book and we walked over. It was 100 times nicer and 10 euro cheaper. They had wireless internet for very reasonable prices and the breakfast that was included was very nice! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: artlover1
Reviews.Content: After lots of reading on this site we choose Hotel Alimandi Vaticano. The location was directly across the street from the Vatican. We enjoyed a delightful breakfast each morning. Our room was very clean with a large bathroom. We had an issue with the air conditioning and contacted the front desk. They quickly adjusted the temp. from the front desk and it cooled down very quickly. So, if you stay here, understand that they control the temp by computer, not the thermastat in the room. They helped us follow up on lost luggage, it arrived the next day. By their reaction, this is not uncommon on the Italia airline we used. We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel. Wish I could say the same for our hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, family hotel”
Reviews.Author: WrldExplr
Reviews.Content: As a family of four, we found the quad room we had to be large and comfortable. Even though located on a busy street, the hotel has sound-proofed windows. We found the accomodations to be up to the 4-star rating--beautiful bathrooms, comfortable beds, good air conditioning. The breakfast was delicious and ample, as other reviewers have commented. The staff was wonderful and willing to help with whatever we needed. We took the shuttle to the airport, which is a rare benefit for Rome hotels. We enjoyed staying in the Vatican area, but it isn't close to many of the Rome sites. The metro is about four blocks away, and taxis were more convenient to some parts of town. Overall, a great visit and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel Near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: smintzuf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights for our Italian Honeymoon. It was a nice little resonably priced hotel if you are looking to stay somewhere near the Vatican. However, it is not really conveniently located near the Metro, which will take you into ancient Rome. The rooms were pretty small (average size of rooms in Italy) however the bathroom was VERY small. We had a minor problem with our sink leaking, but the hotel fixed it right away and apoligized several times! The breakfast buffet was huge, and probably one of the best we had while we were in Italy. The hotel staff was also very nice and actually saved us some money because we were suppose to be in two different rooms during our stay, however he put it is just one which happened to be cheaper then the other one. I would definitly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quite little place that is not near all the major attractions in ancient Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlee3379
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the place to stay while in Rome. Clean and modern with spacious rooms and a varied and tasty breakfast buffet, but its best asset is its staff. The staff is cheerful, helpful and does everything necessary to make your stay comfortable. This hotel is located across from the entrance to the Vatican Musuem. There is easy access to the rest of Rome by nearby bus and Metro stops. I recomment this hotel highly. A real bargain for the service and accomodations that you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Issues ... Money and Room!”
Reviews.Author: PattiLee50
Reviews.Content: After much research (especially on Trip Advisor), we decided that Hotel Alimandi in Vaticano would be a fabulous choice. I had read that booking this hotel through Rooms Accommodation was very advisable. So...about a year ago, we booked two rooms with balconies for 180 euros a night for two nights for June of 2008. Several months later, we were forced to change our dates, and now reserved the same rooms but in April of 2008. We were told the rate would now be 200 euros. When checking in, we were told that was not possible! They do not have rooms with balconies and even though I had the confirmation in hand, they also would not honor the 200 euros per night. Our cost: 260 euros for one room and 240 euros for the other. When we came back from a tour of the Vatican, another person at the desk said he would deduct 20 euros a night from each room. As an aside, our luggage was stored in the "secure" room and brought up to our room. Unfortunately, my medicine was no longer in my suitcase. On the bright side, the breakfast was plentiful, the room was fine (although very loud with scooter traffic all through the night), the bathroom was lovely, the rooftop deck was wonderful, and the location suited us well. By the way, when we were up on the rooftop deck, we did see the two rooms with balconies on the third floor. Hmmmm....

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: WineGoddess6
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano for 6 nights at the outset of our recent visit to Italy. The hotel is located literally right across the street from the entrance to the Vatican Museum - couldn't be better ! Many of the "must-see" places are within walking distance, such as the Trevi Foundation, Piazza Navonna, the Spanish Steps, Campo de Fiore, Trastevere, etc. The Metro station is close by as is the bus service to places further afield. The hotel itself is clean, comfortable and serves the most splendid breakfasts I have ever eaten in Europe! Our room was located away from the street, facing an inner courtyard, and so was very quiet at night; it was comfortable and well-equipped. The staff were pleasant, not overly helpful but within the limits of acceptability. The best part about the hotel is its location with respect to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJHarkin
Reviews.Content: the hotel is at the entry and exit otf the vatican city and about a 10 min walk to the heart of it for buses and metros.the staff really helpful and friendly.the rooms were spotless with very modern bathrooms. the drink in it was probably the cheapest in the city,even the mini bar.definitly will be back. Be aware though,there is a three star hotel one street away which shares the same name but does not look as good.this one is 4 star

Reviews.Title: “very friendly family run hotel with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: SpikeSheffield
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 very pleasant nights at this hotel.We were up-graded from the b& b option on arrival and although our room was quite small it was adequate in every way. The whole hotel was spotlessly clean. But, for me the main attractiion of this hotel was the friendliness and helpfulness of the owners and staff - particularly the breakfast chef who made our breakfast experiences on the roof terace so enjoyable. I think the location was ideal because it was easy to escape the main tourist haunts to expereience more of the true Rome and easy enough to either walk, bus or tube your way into the main attractions. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SussexFiJ
Reviews.Content: We had a very cheerful welcome and immediately some really useful tips about how to maximise our time and avoid queues which were invaluable to making sure our weekend went as smoothly as possible. After experiencing the high prices around we were pleased to find the hotel offering very reasonable drinks prices. The rooms were immaculate, the service excellent and we had no noise from outside. Excellently situated for the Vatican and near the Metro. All in all the perfect place to stay for a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 3weavers
Reviews.Content: Although I have not yet stayed at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano, I have been communicating with the staff since October 2007 regarding my reservations for this April. I have had excellent and prompt service to all of my E-mails - I have not travelled to Rome before and have had a lot of questions ; to which I have been given professional and helpful replies. The staff ( Nico, Aldo) have been wonderful and I look forward to my stay at this hotel! Mrs. L. Weaver Kamloops, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: bluebus
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vaticano.. Booked 3 nights here based on the good reviews found on tripadvisor. Really enjoyed the stay at what I suppose is a reasonable rate given that it is Rome and is at the Vatican! I found the location great .. easy to find especially having just arrived from the airport or making your way around.. well the Vatican is a fairly hard landmark to miss! Was also very useful in terms of getting hop on hop off bus around the other sites of Rome given the Vatican stop was beside the hotel. The room was clean and spacious... loved the marble floors... good en suite, shower, beds etc. The staff were very helpful and always friendly and the breakfast in a nice room and just the thing to set you up for the day. The room had also probably the first reasonably priced minibar I have encountered in a big city... bout the same price as normal. . euro for coke, water etc... and we did polish off a few bottles of beer, wine, champagne etc. which also cost no more than the bar. On the down side the room had no airconditioning... or rather id did but it was broken. This wouldnt be a problem only for the heating being on full blast all night requiring us to leave the window open all night.. which brings me onto another point... this is a very noisy street.. and I mean veeeeeerrrrry noisy! The rattling of cars, scooters, mopeds, horns, beeping etc. going past the hotel was very loud, no chance of a sleep in anyway! There are a number of good restaurants close by, couple of bars, nice walks around the Vatican... Might not be the best place for those looking for nightlife though! Over all we had a great stay.. would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rome.”
Reviews.Author: monkeymuppet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position if you want to visit the Vatican museums, however, be prepared for a 30/40 minute walk to get into central Rome. I booked the Hotel through it's own website i'd booked a superior room but when we arrived we were given a superior room with TWO king sized beds, not very romantic. When i complained i was told this was there superior rooms but according to the website there is a double superior room so it was a bit confusing. I was offered a double room which i took, but it was a bit annoying having expected to stay a double superior room. Staff are very friendly and helpful, the recepionist even booked us tickets to visit a museum. Hotel and rooms are clean and tidy. Breakfast is good but very strange as it seems that alot of the cooked food is left overs from the previous night. It was a pleasant stay but if we were to return to Rome (as we probably will as we threw some coins in trevi fountain) we will stay somewhere closer to the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Average Alimandi”
Reviews.Author: FamilyT-Stokesley
Reviews.Content: Is this the number one hotel n Rome? The answer is definitley not. The Good 1) The hotel is spotlessly clean 2) The staff are friendly 3) The bathroom goodies are great The Bad 1) The hotel must be on one of the nosiest steets in Rome - light sleepers avoid 2) The family room was very small, room for two double beds and not much else 3) The hotel was exceptionally warm and the air conditioning didn't seem to work 4) The breakfast is bizarre - last time we stayed in Rome we had fresh mozerella, parma ham, crossiants and breads - this was an odd concotion of lasagne, chocolate cake, fried prawns, etc. The Ugly 1) The hotel must be on one of the dirtiest streets in Rome, both of my children managed to stand in dog dirt just outside the hotel and the pavements are littered with rubbish. Overall I would not recommend to anyone, the Almandi is over priced and distinctively average.

Reviews.Title: “OKish”
Reviews.Author: TravellerKent_UK
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand why this hotel was No.1 on Trip Advisor for so long! The location isnt the best, OK it is opposite the Vatican but what about the other sites in Rome? The hotel itself was OK, we were greeted with coffee and cake and our room was available at 11am. However, the reception area was being redecorated which meant that you could not go through to the bar during the day. Also the room was so warm that it made it uncomfortable and you couldnt open the window due to the traffic noise, it was like sitting in the middle of the M25! If I was to visit Rome again I would stay somewhere near the Spanish Steps as it has more of a buzzy atmosphere with places to eat and drink and of course shop.

Reviews.Title: “Easily the worst customer service experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: Crouchy10
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at this hotel in the Autumn of 2008 based on the very high rating given here. Due to unforeseen circumstances however, I had to cancel. Cancellation was duely confirmed by the hotel in November 2008. This I thought would be the end of the matter - but o, no! Just a few weeks ago I received an email stating that I would be charged for a no-show. I understand that errors occur, and emailed the hotel. They confirmed that an error had been made, and that all I needed to do was to confirm my bank details and that a refund would promptly be made. Two weeks later, and numerous emails later, I have received no refund and not even had the decency of a reply from this hotel. In all my years of travelling this is easily the worst customer service I have to endure. Mistakes I can handle, but something that leaves me significantly out of pocket,leaving me at risk of overdraft at the bank is tantamount to theft. AN UTTER DISGRACE. The hotel might be fine to stay in, but don't expect them to treat you with decency and respect of it goes wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Booking Amendments”
Reviews.Author: jb12
Reviews.Content: In response to the below review, complaining about the booking system; I have recently booked a 5 night stay with the hotel for the beginning of June. After making the booking I was forced to amend the booking twice. I did this by e-mailing the hotel directly and both times I had a response within 5 minutes confirming the amendment to my reservation as I had requested. It seemed the staff were only too happy to help and we are looking forward to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay at Reasonable Rate”
Reviews.Author: gualdolover
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alimandi during my stay in Rome in February. As far as location, it is steps from the vatican and the sistine chapel. It is also extremely clean and the staff there speaks English and is very 'Sympatico". I especially liked the chef at breakfast, Fernando.. who is friendly and accomodating. I loved this hotel and would stay there again. Because I have family in umbria, I have stayed in Italy at least 30 times, and this is the best hotel in Rome for the money. OH.. and the breakfast was excellent!!! Eggs, toast, bacon ... we skipped lunch because we ate so much.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: citytourers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in room 207 while our friends were in 305 - our room was unbelievable - the bed was huge and the bathroom had 2 sinks! Two large windows overlooked the vatican museums. Unfortunately our friends had to suffer an unpleasant drains smell emanating from their bathroom (2 large double beds but only 1 sink!) - but evenings drinking wine from their terrace, overlooking the vatican, were wonderful. The staff were lovely and helpful - even supplying us with glasses and a corkscrew to open our shop bought wine! Breakfasts were a real talking point - spinach, turkey burgers and chips, fried egg on toast on courgettes, some sort of shell fish on spaghetti, carrots, chocolate cake, chocolate mini easter eggs (yum) etc...... and all stone cold! The good points - there was a microwave to heat it up, and the juices, fresh fruit and croissants were all lovely! We did wonder if the veg were left over from dinner the night before! The best thing we did before we went was organise 2 private tours with Through Eternity - a magical 3 hour night car drive around Rome and a 1 day walking tour. The 1 day tour was amazing - our American guide picked us up at our hotel at 10am and left us at the Pantheon at 8pm - and there wasn't much that we missed! We had a lovely lunch and went to the Vatican museum in the afternoon when there were no queues at all. In fact we didn't have to queue for anything. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: liked_copper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem, 4 of us stayed here for a weekend in January. It's spotlessly clean, lovely staff, great breakfast, great location to get around Rome, its right opposite the Vatican Museum entrance and a 10 min walk to St Peters. They offer a free shuttle service which is great, we didn't know that arriving but found the hotel easily by getting a train from the airport to termini and then the metro to the hotel. Going back we got the shuttle bus. Would definately stay here again, great spot, made our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Book the Alimandi as fast as you can!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bsilberg
Reviews.Content: We found the Alimandi and its updscale sister property, the Alimandi Vaticano, through Rick Steves' Rome travel guide. We needed a hotel, fast, near Rome Children's Hospital, where our son was being treated. We spent a night in the 4-star Vaticano, loved it, then found out we'd be staying a while and happened on a large and very comfortable B&B type apartment in the same building, owned by the Alimandi family. It was wonderful, came with all hotel amenities, including the spectacular breakfasts, cheap or free wi-fi/internet access, shuttle service and kind, warm, friendly and helpful service from the family members (one of the owners even made soup for our son, who hated the hospital food). I cannot speak highly enough about these properties and the truly gracious and warm Alimandi family. We didn't stay in the three-star, but it looked very nice, and the rooftop breakfast lounge was a treat given our son's illness, and the guy who ran the breakfast spot was an absolute gem. Our son turned out to have lymphoma, so we stayed almost a month, but he has since been treated back home in New York and his prognosis is excellent. We plan a celebratory stay back at the Alimandi next summer. We consider the owners friends, if not family. And the apartment may be the best deal in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: LMRS
Reviews.Content: My Mum and I stayed at Hotel Alimandi Vaticano for Christmas. We were escaping really because of a berevement in our family and so were not expecting to enjoy the festive season but looking for a distraction more than anything. Suprisingly it turned out to be one of the best trips I've taken and I believe that to be because of the comfort of the hotel and the attentiveness of the staff. We stayed in a 'supreme' room and I'm not sure how nice the ordinary rooms are but I would say it would not have made much of a difference to our experience. Everything was perfect and the staff went out of their way to assist us in anything we wanted and in finding out information about what was open and on over the holidays. We were even given a card, small italian Christmas cake and bottle of Presecco as a present on Christmas Day and they organised Christmas Lunch for us at the last minute in a local restaurant which was fantastic. The breakfast each morning was a large and varied buffet that contained some strange additions (lasagne, mixed veg) but would satisfy the largest appitite or the most finiky of eater. Overall, a really lovely holiday at a sad and difficult time in our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location and Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: travler325
Reviews.Content: Each and every person there was helpful. The room was very clean, neat and modern. What more could an American traveling in Italy ask for. I would stay again. I am planning on staying again, I will not shop around. The hotel is close to everything. Perfect location

Reviews.Title: “Great family-run hotel for our family”
Reviews.Author: smithatnt
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (with two teenage daughters) stayed at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano in early October, both on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews and because they had a family room that would accomodate the four of us. We weren't disappointed. We all enjoyed the breakfasts, and the rooms were very clean and spacious. My wife felt the mattresses were too hard, but I liked them, since I can't stand a soft and springy mattress--I guess this is just a matter of personal preference. The staff, both in the reception area, kitchen, and housekeeping, were all very helpful and friendly--what you might expect from a smaller, family-run hotel. If you stay here, walk a few blocks north to visit the Andrea Doria outdoor market; you can feel like a local, shopping for something for lunch or dinner that day, and the whole market is very un-touristy. Also, some of the reviewers mentioned how unsafe they felt in Rome, or that they had been pickpocketed. We felt quite safe, and I think that a little common sense would prevent most of these situations. Our whole family agreed that we loved Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Router50
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic weekend away on the strength of the ranking and recommendations on Tripadvisor and was not disappointed. We stayed in a larger room on the second floor (room 203). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I had a problem getting money from the ATMs there (some banks ask for a 6 digit pin) and the female member of staff took on my problem as if it were her own. While the hotel is located on a busy road (Viale Vaticano) directly opposite the Vatican Museums, the shutters and the windows prevent the sound from being too intrusive. Unfortunately, the Vatican Museums were not open on the Saturday we visited (one of only 2 Saturdays they are closed in the year) but Rome is not lacking in other delights! The hotel is 5 minutes from St Peters Basillica and 15 minutes walk from the central part of Rome (Centro Storico). You can catch the Metro (3 minutes walk) or the number 81 bus (same distance) there if walking is not your thing. The hotel does not offer lunch or evening meals and I found their breakfast adequate. I could see why people have complaints about the hot food there as the food looked a little tepid but is is absolutely fine for cerials, cold meats. toast etc. The chocolate cake was unexpected and the fact that it was nearly all gone the next day was even more unexpected. Who eats chocolate cake for breakfast!? In summary, I don't think we could have enjoyed our stay in Rome more, thanks partly to the Alimandi Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ahegarty
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Rome if you want a quiet, elegant place to come back to at the end of the day. The staff are friendly and helpful but never pushy. The rooms are elegant, simple, comfortable. There is no hard sell, no excess of amenities as in very fancy places. Breakfast is delicious. You will be accross the street from the vatican museum. St. Peters is 10 minutes away. The underground is a few blocks away. Accross nearby bridges are neighborhoods musums and churches where you find everything you want. No its not a "grand hotel" - they give you what you need, when you need it. There is no excess of services you may not use. When we return to Rome, here is where we will be staying. Its home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation, breakfast and service”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Sheppard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, our first visit to Rome. The room, 305, had two large double beds, flat screen TV with Sky and DVD player and mini-bar. Mini bar prices very reasonable, for example, 1Euro for a fruit juice. Bathroom had efficient modern shower and large bath. Everything worked. Room was very clean. We also had a private roof terrace with table and chairs where we could sit out and have coffee in the morning, overlooking the vatican wall and entrance to the vatican museum. Coffee is a room service option as there is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, but cost is very reasonable. The young lady on the reception was very helpful in suggesting restaurants and on Sunday went out of her way to find us a special restaurant, that was open, for a birthday celebration. Will go back to Rome and will go back to this hotel. It's location is west of the city and our routine was to get a cab or bus to the furthest most site and meander back past other places of interest on our way back. The only downer was the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great”
Reviews.Author: xzabion
Reviews.Content: The hotel was the last stop on my honeymoon. I reserved the hotel room 204 only to get upgraded to 304, this room over looked the entrance to the vadican. It was fantastic. The balcony was wonderful, great view. The room was a decent size considering we were in Italy. Very clean and the mini-bar was very resonable. I would give a 5 star recommendation to this hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely happy with our stay at the Alimandi Vaticano!”
Reviews.Author: moesk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alimandi Vaticano from 11/9 to 11/16 and had a wonderful time. When we arrived at the airport, we called for the shuttle and it was there in 20 minutes. We were early so we left our luggage and walked around for an hour or so to buy a 7 day metro pass and to get our bearings. Our favorite things about the hotel were the delicious breakfasts, the size and cleaniness of the room, the heated towel rack, and the helpfulness of the front desk. Yes, you are a distance from sites other than the Vatican and St Peters. But, the metro was 5 minutes away, completely safe and easy to use. The 7 day pass costs 13 euros each and was well worth it. We went the 6 days without taking any cabs and only 1 bus. Though, a suggestion, walk as much as you can. You never know what you will find around the corner in Rome. We have already recommended this hotel to friends who will be visiting in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Be a neighbour to the Pope”
Reviews.Author: HolidayTriptester2
Reviews.Content: We checked Tripadvisor for the best hotel in Rome and booked it. The Hotel Alimandi Vaticano is well placed right next to the Vatican Museum entrance, and the near the Metro and bus stops. The Hotel was spotless and the staff friendly and helpful. The mini bar is cheaper than the stalls. Soft drink 1 euro and beer 3 euros. The Bar was also good value for money and free buiscuts and nuts . The hotel was a great place to come back to after a hard day pounding the streets of history. Marble floors, firm mattress and feather pillows. The only down side the shower was a little small and no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. The breakfast was self service and a good choice. Use the micro wave to heat food if desired. I would recommend this hotel, and they are proud of their rating in tripadvisor as they have a copy on the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMR85
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. The location is fine for most of the places that you want to go. The room was clean and a fresh change from the gaudy rooms of other hotels. The beds were divine and the breakfast very hardy. A good price for a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyermom
Reviews.Content: Great location if you are going to the Vatican Museums as it is right across the street. Please note, it is a bit of a hike around the Vatican walls to St. Peter's. The staff at check-in was very helpful and informative with information about buses, metro, Vatican, etc. All spoke good English. Since we had five people, it was very cost effective for us to hop a taxi. Free internet access in your room is a plus. It's wired--bring an ethernet cable. Breakfast buffet was extensive with several hot choices as well as a very broad array of cold choices. They are obviously catering to a mutli-national clientele. (One morning there were some curry type rices dishes, for example.) The two servers seemed to be working very hard. We stayed four nights in a quad room (two double beds). Room 104. The room and bathroom were large by European standards. (About the size of a typical U.S. hotel room.) There is a free room safe you program yourself--it's a good idea to use and not carry more than you need as pickpockets are a problem in Rome. The beds were firm and comfortable. There was a flat screen TV with quite a few English language channels. The minibar had excellent prices--often better than street vendors. For once, we used it. (For example,1 Euro for a can of soda or water) If street noise is a problem for you, ask for a room higher up. The windows are quite noise-proofed, but it is on a busy street. Just a few minor concerns. For a 4 star hotel, there were some small maintenance issues.--an off hole in the floor of our room (a little bigger than size of a quarter) and some plaster needing repair. We had a bit of a hassle as one of our sons joined us unexpectedly--adding a fifth person. No extra room was available, but it seemed it was a hassle for them to let him stay in the room. We seemed to have to go over the whole situation with each manager as they came on duty. There is free shuttle to the main Rome airport (FCO) but it only runs at certain times and you need to reserve a spot. (7 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.) Very nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for Vatican!!”
Reviews.Author: SonyaTexas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alimandi Vaticano is a great place to stay if your priority is visiting the Vatican. We booked a standard room. It was large by European standards, and the bathroom was all marble and roomy. Clean rooms a plus! There is a WONDERFUL buffet breakfast that includes eggs and bacon! Hotel is across the street for the entrance to the Vatican museum.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel Near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: VAtravels
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable 2 night stay at this property. The hotel staff was very helpful with providing recommendations and assisting with any of our needs. The room was very clean with lots of marble throughout. Our Room was on the 3rd floor facing the back of the hotel which made it very quiet. There is a very nice roof-top deck where we met many fellow travelers and shared some wine and stories. The included breakfast is very extensive and sure to tempt anyone. Fresh fruit, pastries, cereal, eggplant, chicken wings, and even marinated octopus! All very good! The hotel is located at the Vatican museum entrance, and it is about a 10-15 minute walk around the wall to St. Peters.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: fulhamite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great to return to after a long day sightseeing. The room was big, great bathroom.The room faced the road so there was traffic noise. The only drawback was that there is no restuarant so no matter how tired you are you have to go out to eat. The hotel staff are all very friendly and helpful and speak excellent English. Staying in such a nice hotel added to our enjoyment of such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hughesphx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Alimandi for 3 nights prior to a cruise. I booked a deluxe room and was not disappointed. The room, #207 was huge by European standards and beautiful. One warning, however. The traffic noise from the street is quite noticeable, even with the windows closed. The wall of the Vatican across the street creates a tunnel effect and all of the traffic noise is reflected back at the hotel. If you are sensitive to noise, book a room in the rear part of the hotel. Personally, I used earplugs and slept like a baby. The breakfast is quite nice and the desk personnel are very helpful. The Vatican is next door, of course and the other Rome highlights are within walking distance (a long walk) or a taxi ride of about 10 euros. Or book a hop-on hop-off bus tour to take you where you want to go. If you stay at the Alimandi don't miss "Old Bridge Gelato", across from the Vatican wall about halfway to St. Peters square. The best gelato we found in all of Italy.

Reviews.Title: “This One is a Winner”
Reviews.Author: BizTravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: After reading all the Rome Hotel reviews I decided that Rome was not a place to cheap out on a hotel and settled on this property based on the reviews here, for our four-night stay. This hotel is spotless and beautifully designed and everything in the room worked well. The air conditioner was powerful but quiet. They have rubber gaskets around the door which mitigates but does not eliminate that annoying door-slamming noise you hear from near-by rooms in all hotels. We were at the back of the hotel and it was very quiet overall. The minibar prices - for once - were reasonable and we did not bother looking for water and soft drinks outside the hotel. The room was on the compact side for 2 of us but we did not find this an issue since it was so comfortable otherwise. The breakfast buffet was excellent and catered to several national tastes. The hotel's restaurant recommendations also proved to be excellent and we worked through the menu at La Rustichella, a short walk into the local neighbourhood. We were not able to use the free airport shuttle service on arrival since the last pickup is at 2 PM and we arrived later. But it was good going back and the saving on the taxi fare is an offset to this hotel's high rate. The staff was efficient and helpful. The people here know how to run a hotel and it will be our first choice if we have a chance to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Italian family experience”
Reviews.Author: Hungaria
Reviews.Content: While in Rome, do as the Romans do.............definitely stay at the Alimandi hotel. The people are family oriented and friendly as all "get out". We were treated with respect and never an unfriendly word. The personnel were always smiling and helpful. The personal rooms were kept immaculate and the hotel in general was very well kept. AND breakfast was wonderful. Can't say enough good remarks for you to read.........only thing to do is go and stay there and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sak475
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Excellent. Rome was the last leg of a 2 week trip and we stayed here our last two nights. The front desk people are very helpful... We drove in with a rental car and they arranged to have the rental car company come and pick up the car so we wouldn't waste the time dropping it off ourselves. The hotel is right across the street from the vatican museum so it is in a very good location. The subway is about 5-6 block away (10 minute walk). The room itself is very nice. It had a little balcony, was very clean and had a nice bathroom. Unlike a lot of hotel where the AC is a wall unit, this hotel has central air. The hotel also has a free shuttle to the airport which is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Dave9
Reviews.Content: I bet there are some really grotty hotels in Rome but this isn't one of them. Our room was really well appointed with nice furnishings. We didn't pay for the street view (superior rooms) so looked out to a courtyard at the back and we had no noise at all from traffic, despite the hotel location in the centre of Rome. The entire hotel is very well presented (leather seats in dining area etc) with modern fixtures and fittings. Good, quiet, air con and strong and soundproof double glazing units. The staff were friendly throughout our stay. The breakfast was excellent and really well presented - asparagus and chicken wings as well as all the usual items! Do take the lift to the 4th floor - doors open onto a rooftop terrace with pot plants, tables and chairs and with views around of the vatican (well the walls at least). If you have small children, be aware of the windows. We had a 3rd floor room and the window was only waist height, with a 40ft drop to a paved courtyard. It made me feel a bit dizzy and would be a risk to children - although city breaks are not usually a child thing. We thought the location was great - especially for St Peters. We walked there each evening to see it all lit up. The other sights are just about walking distance GREAT PLACE TO EAT- 'Angellotti ai musei' hostaleria (spelling may not be exact). Left out of hotel, walk to traffic lights but don't cross. Turn left and its on the corner of the next street you cross. We had two soups, two pizzas, half litre of red wine and litre of water for €35. Went there all three nights and the pasta is great too. Always quite busy but the waiters think it a personal insult if they turn you away. SUPERMARKET - very hard to find in Rome and we only found this on our last night. Follow directions to the bar above and turn left just before it. Walk down that street and it's on your left. No need for water though - the tap water in Rome is fantastic and perfectly safe to drink (in fact it was nicer than the bottled water).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: StarWatcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi Vaticano for 3 nights in August. I must say, it was absolutely perfect! A definite 4 star hotel. Everything is new and in pristine condition. There were four of us (including 2 teenagers). We had a quadruple room which had 2 queen size beds. The room was just beautiful, and the bathroom was really nice....lots of marble everywhere! They were very accomodating.....called us taxi's when needed, made restaurant reservations, gave us directions, advice. Very, very nice! It's literally right next to the vatican museum. It's a little ways away from the center of all the attractions though, but after spending a day down there with all the crowds and tourists, it was nice to get back to the Alimandi where it was quiet. Once the vatican closes, it literally becomes almost like a "ghost town" around that area. It was a little eery feeling at first, but the area is very safe, and we came to like the quiet after a day of touring. Great gelato places just down the steps and around the back streets of the hotel. Unless you want to be right in the center of things with all the crazy, busy, touristy stuff going on, I would highly recommend this hotel....it was just perfect! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Alimandi Vaticano is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ndfans
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (including two teenage boys) stayed 5 nights at the four-star Hotel Alimandi on Viale Vaticano at the end of July. It was absolutely perfect in every way! It is very difficult to find a hotel room in most European cities that can comfortably accommodate a family of four or five (so in other European cities we have booked apartments), but the quadruple room we had was huge by European (and even American) standards! It was spotlessly clean with a modern bathroom, marble floors, individually controlled air conditioning, a mini-bar refrigerator, comfortable beds, large closets and free in-room internet access. Ask for room 305 (quadruple superior with two queen-sized beds) and you will even have your own terrace overlooking the Vatican Museum entrance (great for checking out the lines!). The breakfast selection was excellent (hot entrees, fruit, yogurt, pastries). Definitely use the complimentary airport shuttle (Fiumicino airport only) as this will save you at least 40 euro taxi fare each way. The location is excellent for the Vatican and St. Peter’s (directly across the street from the Vatican Museum entrance) but a bit further out from the main city center and attractions (roughly 3 miles to the Colosseum and 1.5 miles to Piazza Navona). However, we used the metro frequently (about a 7 minute walk to the Ottaviano stop) and when we were tired at the end of the day took a taxi back (roughly 9-10 euros from the city center). Even adding in the cost of taxis, it was less expensive to stay here than to book two (more costly) double rooms of lesser quality in the city center. The area around the hotel is nothing special but nice for seeing how the locals live. There is a supermarket about a block and half away that we used to buy drinks and snacks for the room. All in all, this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in, and was absolutely wonderful for a family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: M&T99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi Vaticano for a long week-end in early July. We had a family room (2 adults + 2 children). Room was clean, nice bathroom and 2 large double beds. Hotel location is great for the Vatican and at first we thought it a bit far out from the city centre. However after spending a couple of nights in the city centre trying to find nice restaurants we actually preferred the location around the hotel. Taxi to the centre costs about 7 Euros but subway is very close to the hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good. Overall an excellent choice of hotel. We were very happy with it. Queues for the Vatican were enormous and people started queuing before 7am (it didn't open to non-groups until 11am!) but you are right opposite the museum entrance. Very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: hapnats
Reviews.Content: As this was our first trip to Rome we did not know what to expect. We were extremly happy with the experience at this hotel. From check in , breakfeast , room, location and check out all were fantastic. The hotel is family owned with the staff treating you like part of their family. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. If we ever get back to Rome this would be our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and More!”
Reviews.Author: Almagetty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alimandi Vaticano earlier this month with some other families for a pre-cruise stay. I cannot say enough good things about the Alimandi and its staff. The hotel is simply wonderful. The rooms are spacious by European standards; the beds are very comfortable; the bathroom is amazing and spotless. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. The hotel's staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel was perfect. We walked everywhere and, at night when our feet could not carry us any further, the cab rides back to the hotel from Spanish Steps one day and the Parthenon on the other day were very affordable. I cannot think of one negative thing to say about our stay. We've definitely found our home in Rome for all future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Shame about Rome!”
Reviews.Author: auriez
Reviews.Content: After reading all the hotel accomodation reviews that the main travel operators had to offer & not being very impressed, i decided to book direct to this hotel as it sits at number 4 in the best hotels in Rome on Trip Advisor. We flew easy-jet & saved a fortune on the flight, hotel & transfers. The hotel itself was very easy to find, it is opposite the Vatican Museum, we decided not to bother paying out for taxi's or transfers, we got straight on a coach to Termini Station cost us 6 euro's each, then we took the Metro for 1 euro, neither of us speak any Italian & we had no problems at all, off the metro, top of the steps, turn left & the hotel is right there, you may pass by it if you aren't looking. We had room 105, it overlooked the Vatican so we could see the queues start from as early as 7.30am, the hotel advised us to wait till after 1pm to avoid the huge queues & they were right. the room itself was beautiful, spotless, marble floors, huge bathroom, powerful double shower, toiletries provided, even slippers! the bed was a queen & so comfy plus we had an extra single, we stayed in a double room, i'm glad now we didn't pay extra for a superior, it wasn't necessary. The breakfasts were superb, the staff were friendly, the bar & mini bar prices were very reasonable. Rome itself this time of year is awful, it was hot, so very busy, the queue for the Vatican went all the way round to St Peters every morning, it was dirty, smelly, we saw rats, beggars are everywhere harrassing you in queues & as you walk around, you get harrassed by sellers on the street, the food on the whole is appauling, don't eat in the cafe/restaurant across from the vatican, they have all the food out cooked in a morning, then they just microwave it for the rest of the day. If you love cheese on your food Rome is great, cheese with cheese mmmmm my husband hates cheese so food was a problem I would advise the 24hour christian tour bus, starting just round the corner from St Peters, no where near as busy as the main tour operators but it goes the same routes, you hop on and off at stops, we found we could pretty much walk to Rome from our hotel but it is far & takes its time & does make you tired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: westphillyboy
Reviews.Content: Once again, the TA reviews were on-point. We loved staying here. We stayed for 3 nights. We arranged our stay through the hotel's website. Everything was handled smoothly. From the time of our arrival everything was great. The hotel was very modern with the latest amenities. They even had an ICE MACHINE! Unheard of in hotels in Italy. The staff was professional and extremely helpful. The location was obviously close to the Vatican, but also close to all other sites by walking. Buses & Metro were close to hotel and easy to navigate. Breakfast was the best we had on our trip thru Italy. They also had complimentary shuttle to the airport for departures. It ran on-time and was very comfortable. We would definitely stay here again, when we return to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TiggerJo
Reviews.Content: This really is a fantastic hotel, in a great location, for a very fair price. We booked a standard room - perfect for our budget, and a superior double (for cousins) which really was a stunning room with spacious balcony overlooking the Vatican museum entrance. Both rooms were en-suite, modern and clean and came with well stocked mini-bar! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and guests would do well to heed their advice on the best times to visit the museum opposite. Also take their advice on where to eat, Piacere Molise for simple yet outstanding pasta without the tourist price tag. Breakfast was surprisingly good - something for everyone from fresh fruit and pastries to traditional bacon and eggs with the unusual addition of chicken wings or spring rolls also available?! Not to mention cereal, toast, juices, sacher torte, brownies and fresh coffee or tea. Whilst not close to other sights, transport is easy and it is good for 'real' shopping as it's less than 5 mins walk to via Cola di Rienzo. A great hotel, great location, and great value for travellers looking for a clean & comfortable place to rest and recover from the wonder of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MetsGirl13
Reviews.Content: There are two Hotel Alimadi so make sure you are looking at the right one. We stayed at the Vaticano which was right across from the wall and entrance to the Vatican Museum. It was a great location and a wonderful hotel. The hotel was super clean and the beds comfortable. The hotel has internet access for a fee, but if you walk around the corner to their sister hotel ( a block away) you can acess the internet for free. The Gym is also in the other hotel if you are interested in working off some of the pasta!! The rooms were a little noisy because Rome doesn't seem to sleep. The locals stay out until 3 am, so you hear all the cars and scooters zipping by at all hours. I think you may have this problem anywhere you stay in Rome however. The hotel was super convienent to everything and the hotel was great about calling you taxi's whenever you needed it. The breakfast in the morning was full with plenty to choose from. Some stuff was a little strange (they had jalepeno poppers one morning) but for the most part, it was good. They have an omelet station but that was only open one day we were there. Overall, it was a decent breakfast that filled us up. This is a great hotel and the staff was very helpful. Irene is wonderful and she is there best and most informative staff member to work with. I would highly reccomend this hotel and when we come back to Rome, we will be certainly staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi Vaticano - Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JPSWigan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Alimandi for the last two years at Easter. The staff are polite and very friendly. The hotel is clean and well maintained. Also. it is very accomodating for families as we always take our children (infant included) and they cannot do enough for us. I recommend this hotel if you want to be near Vatican City and the Basillica as they are only a short walk away. We will be stopping there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: JiminVA
Reviews.Content: A great small, modern, full-service European hotel. Our family of 4 had 2 rooms for 4 nights in mid-June and we loved it. Rooms are relatively large, service wonderful, very good breakfast, great bar and lounge area, clean and bright rooms and public areas, free Internet access, and wonderful desk staff that gave great advice about things like restaurants and how to avoid huge lines for museums and sites (for example, they told us that the best time to visit the Vatican Museums/Sistine Chapel-- right across the street from the hotel-- was at 1 pm, and they were exactly right-- zero line, versus a 6-block line in mid-morning. The location is unbeatable for the Vatican; further from most other sites, but within easy taxi or subway access. We loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “After extensive research..........”
Reviews.Author: dotttravis
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, my partner and I booked into the Alimandi in vaticano for a 5 days trip in april 2007. If you have already spent many hours looking for somewhere good to stay then stop looking - you need to stay here. We've used RoomsAccomodation to book our stay and had no problems at all. Through them we got a fabulous discount on our Rome hotel (so much so that we were worried that there was a mistake and we'd be laughed out of the hotel on arrival!) but when it came to checking out of the hotel the ridiculously low RoomsAccomodation price was indeed the one we paid. You don't have to part with a single penny up front, and the cancellation terms are fabulous too. I wouldn't hesitate to use them again. So, what about the alimandi? it is hard to write a review that will do justice to it Comfort ? Tops; Beautiful old building in more than pristine order. Suites lovely with real individual identity. Location? Great; close to the vatican city inside the rione borgo. We love to walk but subway 80yds. Price? Whatever you pay for this is a bargain. I have mourned sant’ anna since it passed, but finding alimandi makes it all worthwhile. The truth is, it is like staying with your favourite aunt who happens to live in a beautiful property, in where it is happening now in rome. She is your favourite aunt because not only does she know how to look after you, she is cool enough to let you have all the space you want. The bed was the most comfortable I have slept in for ages. All sheets and towels changed daily. I would not hesitate to recommend the alimandi to anyone. The entire staff, from doormen to conceirge to maid staff were nothing but impeccably mannered and generous with their help. so...thanks to RoomsAccomodation.com and hotel Alimandi staff

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: m_loone
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel and the staff as well, the location is just perfect don't waist your time looking for more, we decided to go for it through this website, we didn't know about the Hotel Alimandi before...and there is another Alimandi, a bit cheaper just around the corner. this is the website where we booked the hotel for few nights [--]

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonomousdurhamuk
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, spacious rooms and very clean. Staff were very helpful, gave us a map of the city, advised us where was good to eat and booked taxi for departure to airport. Food was very good and lots to choose from. We liked the location, we were there to celebrate one of our 60th birthdays! We like to stay in a good hotel and chose this one from its excellent reviews, and it lived up to them. Would recommend it and would stay again if we ever return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LPF
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel is wonderful. We had a corner room with a private balcony and it was huge by European standards. The staff was helpful and the dinner we had there was wonderful. Be sure to reserve in advance. If you want to be in the middle of all the Rome activities this is not the place for you but if you want a quiet neighborhood within steps of the Vatican and the Vatican Museum it's perfect. You can catch the bus to all the Rome tourist sights in about a 15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “30 yards from the Vatican Musuem”
Reviews.Author: JPG-7
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect for visits to St. Peter's and the Vatican museum. Directly across the street from the Vatican Museum. Great terrace views, friendly staff, and the rooms are comfortable. Recommend for anyone that wants to spend alot of time at the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Alimandi Vaticano”
Reviews.Author: UKDunc
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, brakfasts are great, wide choice of food and drink. Location is great for the vatican museum (directly across the road). City centre attractions are about 15-20 mins walk away. Rooms are very modern, a good size and clean. Staff are very helpful and will help you get the most from your trip to Rome. Overall this hotel represents great value for money compared to other hotels in Rome, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We spent five days here with 100% satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: cartielmell
Reviews.Content: We went on a 5 night stay , and loved every minute of it. The hotel is really great for exploring all the major sites nearby, coloseum, vatican ,trevi fountain, spanish steps all about 10 to 20 minute walks. I researched hotels Through on line booking system RoomsAccomodation.com for hours before choosing this one and got a huge rate discount compared to calling the hotel directly. We spent five days here with 100% satisfaction of every individual, service, and product at this hotel. We have very high expectations of service and we all have been impressed with this staff.
