The concierge made dinner reservations for us and recommendations for sight seeing ( Carrani Tours ). We only used the metro once, to get to the San Giovanni. Apart from that we walked everywhere, to and from all the sights. January is a great time to go in Rome - the weather is sunny although there were lots of people it didn't feel too crowded. I can't imagine what the Vatican must be like in summer though! The area around the hotel is safe. In fact all Rome feels very safe, apart perhaps from the area immediately next to the Termini Station late at night, which still is not all that bad. Two final notes: 1st: Rome is a woderful place and upon leaving we were really hoping we would be able to return there on day soon. 2nd: For our transport from and to the airport we were very happy to have booked by RoomsAccomodation, punctual, talkative and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: MDTravellers
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel! We hated to leave! Everyone who works there is an absolute treasure, from the desk to the restaurant. Rooms are nice and clean --- bathrooms huge. So nice. Everyone so very helpful --- arranged tickets for us to a public audience with the Pope, gave us invaluable tips on sightseeing, restaurants, etc., etc. Really made our trip special. They even took care of our luggage (we were a group of six, so there was a lot!) all day and made all the arrangements for a limo to get us to the airport. My husband was ready to move in permanently! Great location, great food, great staff --- you cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: eglwys
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a marvelous location situated right opposite the entrance to the Vatican Museum. Breakfast was of the continental variety but included bacon and scrambled egg. The staff were friendly and helpful and their English was really good. We had a lovely room with a king size bed which was extremely comfortable. Overall I would recommend this hotel and will book again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peppi2
Reviews.Content: our stay inthis hotel was wonderful. the staff especially Aldo & Enrico ( Nico) who went to so much trouble to find and give us directions to various locations , but all the staff were so helpful ,. the hotel its self is modern ,furnishings are of an exceptionally high standard for a 4 star and the breakfasts are wonderful every taste and culture have been catered for Located opposite the vatican Museum and near to bus, tram ,and metro ,just added to the overall enjoyment of our stay in December this hotel is a real find

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: miloboggyhillocks
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Very efficient staff, informative and helpful all the time, excellent breakfast, home cooking style with variations every morning on hot and cold dishes, the waitress remembered your preference for tea or coffee the second morning onwards. spacious and stylish room, very comfortable, clean and modern toilet, heated tower rack is a plus. i don't quite watch tv so i don't know how many channels do they have, but seems a lot. free internet access all the time in room with your own computer, in room safe large enough to store your lap top, comfortable bed, right in room temperature, right amount of light in room, my room facing the court yard which is quite and bright, large window both in room and in bath room, nice rain shower, and a nice lobby bar with opens until very very late at night. The only thing lacking is a kettle to boil some hot water for tea or coffee in room. location is also very good, literally right opposite the entrance of Vatican Museum, 5 min walk to metro, bus stops and everything includes good restaurants, bars (Italian coffee bar for drink and snacks all day round), supermarkets, even hardware store for glues, tapes and ropes (to mend your luggage, believe me it's something not easy to find when you're travelling), the neighbourhood is quite and safe, i walked a lot around the area at night and it seems to have no problem at all. Also when you take a taxi back to hotel from anywhere, just quote Vatican Museum, drivers always know. This is an all round excellent hotel, I recommend it to everyone travelling single, couple, in groups with older children, with eldery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkoR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano with my wife from 24th Nov - 26th Nov to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. The location was excellent, right outside the entrance to the Vatican Musuem, Sistine Chapel and within a very short walking distance to St Peter's. This was a great starting place as we really wanted to see these beautiful sites. The hotel is also a short walk away from the tourist bus route, from which you can plot your excursions to Spanish Steps, Pantheon etc. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast food was fine and what you would expect - continental. The room was beautiful, big and clean. In short this hotel is everything you would need for a short city break to this lovely city. If I went back to Rome, I would go back to the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano.

Reviews.Title: “#1 in my book”
Reviews.Author: judydau
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the alimandi after reading every review at trip advisor. it surpassed our expectations.I thought I had written a review when I returned,but I haven't seen it.the service was so great that I needed to write again and make sure it got included. the room was large and faced the vatican museum.great to watch the people.the staff couldn't have been more helpful,even to our friends who were staying elsewhere.always patient and answered all our questions. we found the breakfast wonderful.a full pot of american coffee at our table.they much exceeded the service and breakfast we got at the expensive hotel monaco grand canal in venice. they gave directions and maps so we could walk a short distance and ride the bus to piazza venizia,etc. we loved rome,the alimandi and will certainly come back. thank you all for your reviews.they were right on

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: amodle
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Alimandi in October. Since my husband and I had stayed there last year, there was no question where we were going to stay this year. The hotel is wonderful. The rooms are modern and large for Europe. The suites have their own balcony, but the roof top balcony is a welcome retreat after a day of sight seeing. The views are amazing. They offer a great breakfast that is geared more toward the American style. So, they have a varied selection of food. The location is in a perfect spot, right across the street from the Vatican Museums. I love being close to St. Peters Square because it is so beautiful in the evening. Also, in the evening, everything seems to wind down on this side of the Tiber. There are two grocery stores around the corner from the hotel (they are located on the same street as the other Hotel Alimandi ). And, the Cipro Metro stop is close by so it is easy to get any where you want to go. What makes this hotel stand out from the others is the level of service from the staff, generally all family members. From the moment you walk in, you feel very comfortable. Plus, the shuttle to and from the airport is fantastic. Just make sure to notify the front desk in advance if you need a pick up or drop off. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Superior accommodations for our group of 15”
Reviews.Author: Librarianguide
Reviews.Content: We did much of research on Rome hotels for our group of 15 's three-night stay before a cruise, and settled on the Alimandi 4-star for its price, location, free airport transportation, and its already-great reviews here. It's always difficult to make the choice for others, but everyone in our group had very complimentary things to say about the Alimandi, its rooms, its friendly and helpful staff, its wonderful breakfast, and its rooftop views. We especially enjoyed the nice bathroom amenities and the pleasant and relaxing atmosphere. Yet you're only a short walk away from the hustle & bustle of Rome. Easy to get to metro and buses (about a 5-minute walk) and literally a stone's throw from Vatican Museum entrance. Heartily recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: buzzmaster69
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel with my mother on Sunday 15th October, what can i say except fabulous hotel as for the staff they all were fantastic, Aldo,Savio,Enrico,Irene and Anduena, so if they read this please please i want to say a BIG THANK YOU for all your kindness and so very helpful :o) my mother is already planning a return trip for 2007. The room was great and so clean. Near all the major local attractions. I have read some negative reviews on this hotel and all i can say is that i would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome. My mother is 63yrs and mobility problems so i researched all hotels close to the Vatican and i could not have chosen a better hotel. Breakfast was wonderful and set us up for the day. All the staff go above and beyond giving advise on what restaurants to go to, local transport etc..Rome surpassed all our expectations and weather gorgeous. So if any of the staff read this a big thanks from jane in room 205 and her mother and hope to be back again in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, but perhaps the best for the price in Rome”
Reviews.Author: trishweb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before departing from Rome after two weeks in Tuscany. Perhaps because Tuscany was so beautiful, and most of our accommodations fabulous, Alimandi suffered by comparison. At check-in, there was a mix-up with our reservation (a group of 5 people, with 3 rooms reserved), and my aunt was moved to their other hotel, around the corner. Anyway, I must agree with previous reviewers that the modern bathroom was lovely, and the room very clean. However, for 210 Euro per night, the room was too packed with furniture. We barely had room for our suitcases (which we small). The bed linens were of average quality, at best. They had one of those fuzzy blankets that get little pills all over them and feel vaguely like cardboard. I wasn't at all confident that it was washed regularly. The sheets were not fine quality linen, but coarse cotton (maybe). Our room was uncomfortably warm, and since it was one floor above street level, it was impossible to leave the window open to cool the room. Traffic noise, on the street across from the Vatican, was quite loud even with window closed. A query at the front desk about the possibility of turning on AC was met with a shrug. Breakfast was nothing great, and service at breakfast was rushed and bordered on unpleasant. It was all our waitress could do to ask our room number and take a coffee order - not a particularly pleasant Italian send-off. The staff did recommend a nice, local restaurant for dinner. By no means gourmet, just good, basic pasta and veal dishes. The neighborhood is not particularly pleasant, and inconveniently located for any sites other than the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful family owned hotel”
Reviews.Author: R.Campanaro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I called the hotel from our cell phone while getting lost driving around Rome. They literally stayed on the phone and guided us to the front door. Gracia one of the owners even left the hotel the next day and drove with us to drop off our rental car because I kept going in circles in Rome traffic. Everything about this hotel is good the location right across from the Vatican Museum, the rooms and bathrooms are spotless,the breakfast on the rooftop garden ,but first and foremost the owners who are sister and brothers and nieces are so very nice and accomodating.Our first trip to Italy was wonderful we saved Rome for last and the Alimandi family were the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: TommieD
Reviews.Content: Other reviews for this hotel on tripadvisor.com say great things about this property and I will just be adding to those great opinions. This hotel is really great, super location, very helpful and friendly staff and the room we stayed in was great. It really is located across the road from the entrace to the Vatican Museum and St. Peter's is about 5 minutes walk away. We stayed for 3 nights, mid-septenber 2006. I'm not going to repeat what has been said only to add that if we visit Rome again (and I hope we do) then we will look up this hotel to stay. I have recommended this place a number of times since returning and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, smart hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bats-73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel (the 4 star - as I believe they have a 3 star too?), for three nights. This was the nicest hotel on our trip to Italy. The room was very large with a beautiful bathroom. It was very modern and had really nice decor. The hotel was so spotless that we thought it must have been recently refurbished. I couldn't fault the cleanliness at all. Plus we got free movies, which was a bonus. The staff were really nice and very helpful. They always seemed happy to help. They gave us good restaurant recomendations and they spoke excellent English. And let us leave our luggage after we checked out before we had to go for our train. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice. Best one on our trip. The only downside, if I had to find one, was the location. It is a long way from anything apart from the Vatican, but taxi's are quite reasonable and we used the hop-on-hop-off sightseeing bus which goes from the vatican. But if I went to Rome again, I would stay here again, despite the location - it was worth the taxi rides. Plus if you do like walking, it is fine. We walked to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon and the Trastevere area quite easily. (DO eat out in the Trastevere area, it's great!) I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not That Great”
Reviews.Author: fivetools
Reviews.Content: First off, not quite sure why this hotel is ranked so high. Location is ok, service is not very good. However, very comfortable, nice amenities. Overall, I would imagine there are much better places to stay in Rome (p.s., Hotel Farnese is NOT one of them). Here are my thoughts: 1. Location: (B/B-) The location is not great. Close to the Vatican/St.Peter's - nothing else. For everything else (Coloseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navonna, etc.) you need to taxi/subway/bus it home. I'm a New Yorker and didn't even think about walking to any of these sights - way too far. And keep in mind, while there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel - its only one of many bus lines. The next closest bus stop is a 10 minute walk away (as is the closest subway stop). 2. Comfort: (A-/B+) Hotel is very comfortable. Beds and toiletries are first rate. Breakfast was also very good (hot dogs, bacon, coffee of choice, pastries). 3. Service: (C) Pretty bad, from checkin to checkout. Whenever my wife and I asked for directions, recommendations, misc. info - the staff seemed hesitant to help. Service with a frown - literally. On one night, I asked for restaurant recommendations in a certain area (near Spanish Steps) and the staffer just told me, "I don't know any, good food everywhere in Rome just go somewhere where you see lot of people and pretty good." Wow, thanks. They were very helpful with changing a reservation for the Vatican Museum, however.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: koala_girl76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 3 nights at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano based on the great reviews on Tripadvisor. We were delighted with pretty much everything about our stay there. The staff speak excellent english and they could not have been more welcoming, or more efficient and helpful towards us. They were happy to recommend good restaurants in the area and on the morning we checked out, they asked what time our flight was - on hearing that it wasn't until that evening, they said we were welcome to leave our luggage at the hotel until later, if we wanted to spend a few more hours sightseeing before we left Italy. The room we stayed in was exactly as described on the hotel's website. Elegant decor, nice cool marble floor, very big bed with a firm mattress, reasonably priced mini bar and working air conditioning. The bathroom wasn't huge but it was modern, well equipped and spotlessly clean. We were suprised by how quiet and peaceful the hotel was, considering it's right in the centre of Rome and on quite a busy street. But we didn't hear very much street noise or traffic at all from our room and it was very easy to sleep at night. Breakfast was served downstairs in the dining room. It's self service (buffet) apart from coffee, which is waitress service. The coffee wasn't the greatest - a bit weak and watery - but the food was nice enough, nothing fancy just simple but very well cooked basic things like eggs, sauted potatoes, sausages and grilled vegetables, etc. They also had fresh pastries and croissants, which were very nice too. The rooms don't have ironing facilities but you can use an iron and ironing board belonging to the hotel, if you go down to the basement with your things. We did this on the first evening and while it wasn't ideal, it wasn't a big problem either. As the hotel's right in the middle of town, practically next door to the Vatican, it's perfectly located for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne B
Reviews.Content: We always book our reservations for hotels in Europe on [--] because they do not require a deposit and offer good customer service. We were successful once again with our choice for a hotel in Rome for the two nights we were there by reserving two rooms at Hotel Aimandi Viale Vaticano. The hotel staff could not have treated us better. Both Irene and Aldo at the front desk assisted us with our requests for a prompt pick up at the airport, restaurant reservations, as well as calling for taxi's and having them there within minutes for us. Since we had our entire family with us 8 of us in total (my husband, myself, our five children and one of their friends) we needed to be extremely organized. We couldn't have done it all without Irene's assistant. We were only in Rome for a Saturday afternoon and all day on Sunday and wanted to see it all, so I booked a private tour of the Vatican, Sistine Chapel and St. Peter's through Avventure Bellisma ([--]) for Saturday afternoon and a private guided tour of the rest of Rome (including the Pantheon, the Collesseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc.) for four hours on Sunday all prior to our trip. Irene notified us both days when our guides were in the lobby and recommended some great restaurants in the area. Our guide for the Vatican tour said we couldn't have picked a better hotel and my family agreed. We plan on staying here again next year when we make our yearly trek back to Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: gordini
Reviews.Content: Right beside the entrance to the Vatican Museum and only a short walk to St Peters. We were given a huge room with a fabulous bathroom (large bath). The staff were pleasant and helpful. They arranged a tour of the museum which bypassed the enormous queue. Breakfast was good. There were no evening meals but the reception staff recommended very good restaurants close by. We were about 15 mins by metro from the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its rating”
Reviews.Author: Anahid
Reviews.Content: Wow! This hotel really lived up to its rating. It was spotless; breakfast was great; the service was outstanding. I was very pleased, and believe me, I am very hard to please. Would definitely reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near The Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Porsche_Guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano for three nights in late May. This is not a bad place to stay, particularily if you want to spend time at the Vatican. The hotel is directly across the street from the Vatican Museum entrance. The hotel staff was very kind and helpful and they will gladly arrange a guided tour of the Vatican . This will obviate the need to stand in the long long lines at the entrance. We were ushered into the museum within 5 minutes of our scheduled time using a guide. This convenience is well worth the extra fee involved. Our Superior Double room overlooked the Vatican and while this was a nice touch, Vaile Vaticano is somewhat noisy from morning until late evening since it is a major road into a residential area. But when the double-paned windows are closed the noise was not an issue. The BEST feature of the Hotel Alimandi Vaticano is the buffet style breakfast. The food was good, varied and plentyful. It is great to start off a touring day with a good hot meal. Be sure to include the buffet as part of your reservation. And fair warning: There are two Hotel Alimandis the one on Viale Vaticano and one around the rear, simply called the Hotel Alimandi. I would avoid the Hotel Alimandi. We spent two additional nights there, and it is not memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Vatican Easy”
Reviews.Author: Baidun
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in late June and it was a great choice to ensure a visit to the Vatican, stay in a beautifully appointed room and not be too far from the other city sights. The queues for the Vatican entrance started outside our bedroom window at 6.45 am (although you hear nothing) and it gets pretty hot by 10 am, so it is best to plan in advance for a summer tour of the Vatican. Staying at this hotel also means you can be back in your room within 1 minute of leaving the Vatican without the hassle of competing for a taxi ! Service in the hotel was also excellent and they fortunately shared some of our internet costs as their in-room broadband was not working.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the only choice in Rome. It is amazingly clean, sumptiously decorated in marble. The breakfast was amazing with many gourmet choices, asparagus, pastas, in addition to the standard eggs and fruit. I looked at the one or two reviews that were poor and I think these people must have stayed at a different hotel. The staff was friendly and gave perfect directions to the museum ticket line. It is just so elegant and convenient, like a palace. The beds are comfortable, the verandas private and elegant. The maid did come early but I did not have the sign on the door and she promptly left. This is indeed a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi Vaticano Superbo!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 day trip (26th to 28th June) to Rome staying at the 4* Hotel Alimandi. Originally this was bookd as a romantic getaway for me and my fella but unfortunately at the last minute our babysitters let us down and we took our 3 and 1 year olds. On the plus side: Rooms are modern, lcd tv and dvd machine, well stocked fridge (soft drinks 1 euro), air con a godsend - it's 40 degrees there at the moment. Beds comfy, lots of tolietries etc in bathroom. Breakfast choice can't be faulted as others have stated. We stayed on the second floor, room 208 at the end of a corridor. We could see the Vatican if we looked to the right out of our room. The rooms are sound proofed, you forget you're in such a busy city and hopefully they forgot we were there with our sometimes noisy kids! On the minus side: There's no baby change in the downstairs loo-but then there does not seem to be baby changes anywhere in Rome even at MacDonalds! Also, originally I booked this hotel because it offered free airport transfers but was disappointed to learn that this does not apply to Ciampino. Another downside is that room service only provides drinks not food, we arrived late in the afternoon and all restaurants were shut but could get nothing to eat until they opened at 7.30pm. The free map of the city provided is not drawn to scale and we ended up walking for hours on the first night. In summary: Despite the previous paragraph, I believe this hotel to be excellent for couples or those with grown up kids because of the location, the service and the reasonable price. It doesn't have a fancy gym or pool but that's not what you go to the centre of Rome for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Cruising-along
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at Hotel Alimandi (3 star) in mid-May. We loved this hotel and will definitely stay there again if we get back to Rome. The location is great, just across the street from the Vatican, and yet within walking distance to the Roman Forum, Collosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. The staff at the hotel couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. We were given written directions for walking around Rome, advice about local restaurants, and extra help on the day we checked out. Our ride provided by USO to Ciampino Airport was very late in arriving to pick us up, and the staff tried several ways to find a phone number to reach them for us, just to find that the USO office had closed for the day. We were assured that if our ride did not arrive, they would get us to the airport themselves, even though it wasn't the airport they provide transportation to and from. Our room was very nice, large, clean and quiet. We had asked for and received a room with a view of the Vatican. Another plus is their internet service -- extremely cheap! But the best part of all is the delicious buffet breakfast served on the roof-top. Francesco is a gem, so friendly and helpful, bringing fresh from the oven hot sweet breads to our table, making special coffees, taking care that everything is just so. We highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful small hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AllyDick
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alimandi Vaticano is opposite the entrance to the Vatican Museam and the Sistine Chapel. It's away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas. At night it is nice and quiet. The hotel is small (smaller than I thought it would be ) but it is extremely clean. The staff are extraordinarily pleasant. The rooms are very modern and luxurious. The bathroom was gorgeous in the room I stayed in - marble floors, lots of mirrors, lovely shower and lots of 'extras' e.g. free toothpaste, toothbrushes, aftershave etc. The breakfast was amazing. There were sausages and bacon on the buffet. There were loads of lovely cakes as well. The staff running the kitchen were lovely also. I will definitely be staying here again. It was a very pleasant place to stay and not too dear either.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Alimandi Vaticano.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alimandi Vaticano is an exceptional hotel in a great location. There is a lovely roof top garden on the 4th floor of the hotel, and guests staying on the 3rd floor have access to a private courtyard. The hotel was charming, very clean, and breakfast was more than we expected. Aldo gave us several great recommendations for restaurants that were close to the hotel, delicious and reasonably priced. An excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Alimandi Rules!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice! The hotel was superb! The check-in was smooth sailing. Our room was in a terrific location next to the Vatican! The room was first class and the sheets were glorious on a very comfortable mattress. The staff was friendly and helpful and went the extra mile to please my wife and I. The roof top terrace was perfect for sipping a cappicino(excellent) and planning our days. The breakfast buffet was amazing! Recommended restaurants were delicious and not over priced! If your not happy staying here you won't be happy in heaven! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel of all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Almandi - in the 4 star hotel that's across from the Vatican museum. We couldn't take the shuttle since we arrived by train, and couldn't use the shuttle on departure as our flight was too early. Other than that, the rooms were the best of all the hotels we stayed in Italy - and we like them all. the bed was incredibly comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, and the breakfast sumptuous. On the downside, it was the most expensive hotel, but I would definitely stay there again. We ate at the Bella Napoli 2 as suggested by an earlier trip advisor contributor, and it was wonderful. Great food at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LakeFam
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Alimandi Viale Vaticano last week. We chose this hotel based on rave reviews on this site, but were disappointed. I had notified them that our plane would arrive at 9:35 and was told that our shuttle would be available at 10:00. Due to a delay getting baggage, we exited at 10:10 and called the hotel to find out where to meet the shuttle, but were told that the shuttle departed at 10:00 and the next one would not be available for two hours. Surely they had to guess that we would never have time to collect our luggage and trek to another terminal in time for the 10:00 shuttle, even under the best circumstances. We had to take a taxi for 40 euros. At the hotel, I very nicely suggested that it would be helpful to guests if they made it clear that their shuttle runs only at specified times and will not wait for guests, and that the meeting place is outside a different terminal, but it fell on deaf ears. The staff never apologized or expressed any sympathy for our inconvenience. We had to take a taxi to the airport upon check-out also to make sure we arrived on time. When I asked if it was possible for the shuttle to leave 30 minutes earlier if there were no other guests on it, the desk clerk simply suggested we take the earlier shuttle and spend 2 extra hours at the airport. Right. We stayed in Room 204 (210 euros/night) which was adequate but not as large as other reviews suggest. By looking at the fire escape plan on the hall wall, it appeared that only four rooms on each floor were large. There was considerable street noise and our toilet "ran" the entire time (which we mentioned to two different desk clerks but was never fixed). On the plus side, the beds and linens were very, very comfortable, the air conditioning worked well, and plenty of toiletries and nice robes were provided. Rome was very crowded during our stay and the lines to the Vatican Museums were long. When I asked the desk clerk when the best time was to go, she said the lines were always long and the only way to avoid them was to buy tickets for a guided tour from her for 40 euros each. We asked other people around town and everyone else seemed to know that that the lines died down by noon. Hm. Also, when we asked for a taxi to the airport upon departure, we had to pay the hotel 50 euros rather than pay the taxi driver directly (the clerk said they had a contract). Since we had paid 40 upon arrival and the taxi meter read 39 when we arrived at the airport, this "contract" seemed to be in the hotel's best interest instead of ours. I would not stay at the Hotel Alimandi again because of our experience. It wasn't bad, just disappointing. Future guests should be very aware of the shuttle schedule (not mentioned on the RomeBy website we booked through or in any email communication). On a previous visit we stayed at the Albergo del Senato (a 3* hotel, but far superior to the Alimandi 4*) near the Pantheon and preferred that location.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to all expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Stuart H.
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Alimandi Vaticani with friends. We arrange at least one city break each year and this year it was Rome. We like comfort and good standards but also appreciate good value for money and thanks to Trip Advisor we were fortunate to find the Alimandi. It was chosen purely on the strength of the reports and we were not disappointed. Rooms were a good size and spotless and the hotel throughout was of a very good standard. Staff could not have been more helpful from simple requests like the loan of an adaptor to good recommendations for local restaurants and information about public transport. The location adjacent to the Vatican Museum entrance is quiet and ideal for most of the city and the walk back through St Peter's Square at night is wonderful. All areas of the city are in walking distance but when you have a limited amount of time, a good tip would be to buy a 3 day pass for public transport and with a little research the bus services can be very convenient. We tried the Subway onces but it was very hot and like sardines in a tin so we tended to use buses. The highlight of our trip was our visit to the Vatican Museum and St Peter's but be warned, if you want to do it justice, take a guided tour to avoid the queues but also spend time looking around on your own. We spent the best part of a day looking round both. Take a walk/climb up the Dome of St Peter's because the views are worth the effort. Rome was a fabulous place to visit and we saw no evidence of the often reported problems with pickpockets. Even 4 nights is not enough to see it all and if we ever return, which we should because we threw coins in the Trevi Fountain, we would certainly use the Alimandi again and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. Our only niggle was that the free airport transfer was only for Fiumicino Airport and not Ciampino and it was therefore no benefit. We did not discover this until after we had booked but we were pleased that we still chose to use the Alimandi. Hodgson (Winston, Co. Durham) & May (Headcorn, Kent)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BooClarendon
Reviews.Content: Well we just got back from our vacation in Rome. I chose Hotel Alimandi soley based on the reviews from trip advisor. I didnt like the choices the travel agent gave. I have to say the place is very nice and I would stay there again!! The staff was great, they were very nice and helpful. We booked all our tours when we got to the hotel through the tour company they had...Vasotours. It was a good company and we packed in alot of sightseeing in 6 days. They had hotel pick up and the all day tours included a 3 course lunch at a restaurant, which we thought was impressive. Overall it was a great experience, the beds are so comfortable. We had a triple room; 3 ladies. There was big enough room for all our things. The bathroom was beautiful and big!! We were impressed. The roof top patio is very nice. I'm glad we chose this hotel and would do it again if we had the chance of going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Alimandi Vaticano”
Reviews.Author: dong10
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 great days with the wonderful people at the Alimandi Vaticano. From the free ride on the hotel's tram in from the airport, it was just a wonderful stay. The staff was extremly helpful in every aspect of my stay, even when I had to switch rooms in the middle of my stay to accomadate friends who had a booking problem at another hotel. The breakfast buffet was a little of home and Italy combined and was excellent. I will stay here again on my next visit in Oct. and would recommend the Alimandi Vaticano to anyone looking for excellent service at fair prices, and in a quiet setting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello to everybody, I want to tell to everybody what a wonderful hotel is Alimandi Viale Vaticano!!! The staff have been great, the proximity to the Vatican is so convenient. I hope to return soon and i recommend this hotel. Thanks for all Judy

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home today. If like me you haven't a clue of where to go and how to do it, you have to stay here becaue they are soooooo helpful. Went with my mother and 2 children and had a brilliant time, this hotel is pure luxary and with in walking distance of every were. When I go to Rome again I will be staying at the Hotel Alimadi Vaticano.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four four nights 1st -5th April with my husband and two children. Loved it. Rooms are excellent, big enough, well furnished and full modern bathroom. Good location, great breakfast. Mini-bar well stocked at reasonable prices. Soft drink 1 euro/ beer 2 euros. The best thing was the personal service of the staff. Friendly, helpful staff gave advice and guidance on a host of typical tourist questions. When our daughter lost her "teddy and blankie" the staff moved heaven and earth to have it returned from the laundry where it had taken a trip wrapped inside the bedsheets!! The staff were warm and wonderful and this hotel is a real find. Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: darren2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Rome staying at the Alimandi and have to say this surpassed all expectations from the friendliness and service of the hotel staff to the charm and excitement of Rome itself. The hotel is right on the doorstep of the Vatican so location was great. We walked pretty much to every notable attraction Rome has to offer and never once felt threatened and the friendliness of the locals and cafe/resturant staff was great..they didnt seem to be able to do enough for you. A recommended place to eat is in the Novana square called La Dolce Vita.. Spaghetti Carbonara to die for! A great place for people watching, portrait painting and a meeting place for locals and tourists alike to just eat, drink and let the time slip by. Fantastic stay and we will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: marchtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Alimandi on Viale Vaticano is a beautifully renovated and maintained hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Rooms were the largest I have encountered in Europe. The location was delightful - close to transportation and lots of neighborhood restaurants but out of the main tourist haunts (other than the long line waiting to enter the Vatican Museum).

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: doctorjo31
Reviews.Content: I'm an avid traveller. This hotel was one of the best I have stayed at! The service was great - when you needed advise for restaurants or tours or even to walk around Rome - they were there to help you out. The airport shuttle is a plus! The location is great also. Right across the street from the Vatican Museum. Plus nearly all the sights are in walking distance from the hotel. The only place that was too far was the Colloseum - we took a taxi to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, terrible city”
Reviews.Author: goldtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 4-star hotel opposite the Vatican wall (their sister hotel is a 3-star down the Via Tunisia steps about one minute away). The staff is exceptional -- as nice as those at the 5-stars in service-oriented Hong Kong hotels. The breakfast was great and included in the price. The room was clean, all came with a balcony on our floor, quiet (a rare find in Rome supposedly) and nicely modern. I would stay here again. The location is not truly central as you must ride the subway for about 15 minutes to get near the Roman ruins or Spanish steps, but the price is good value. Aside from the Vatican, the neighborhood is more residential than tourist which made it fun. The only downside is that it's in Rome -- my least favorite European city so far due to the street crime, graffiti, lack of sufficient public transport and general unfriendliness of locals. We had a taxi driver and subway ticket seller try to overcharge us. We were mugged once. Rome needs New York's Mayor Rudy Giuliani to come in and conduct a thorough clean-up. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Hotell Alimandi”
Reviews.Author: looper63
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Alimandi(4star) in Rome. Large quad room was perfect for my wife, 2 boys and myself. Everything was spotless and clean. Reception was always friendly and helpful with advice. Hotel is located directly across from the Vatican Museum, making it convenient to all Vatican tours. Metro is nearby, but we used taxis to get around. Furthest trip was an 8euro ride to the Colloseum. Alimandi offers a free airport shuttle as well. No surprises at this hotel, pure pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alimandi, 99 Viale Vaticano.”
Reviews.Author: Hynes57
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. From the moment we were collected by the hotel in the free shuttle from the airport to the time we were brought back to the airport we were looked after very well. The staff are very efficient and friendly and cannot do enough to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The rooms are spacious and spotless and everything you need for your stay is provided for not only the usual soaps and shampoos but toothbrushes, shaving sets, shoe cleaners and even slippers. The breakfast in the morning was also fantastic with a huge array of food catering for all tastes. I will be recommending this hotel to everybody I know visiting rome.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were guests at the Hotel Alimandi for two weeks in January 2006. We have stayed in many hotels, bed and breakfasts, etc. Hotel Alimandi out-performs all of them. The front desk staff are professional, yet personal and helpful. They converse in your native language, whatever it may be. They are helpful in suggesting places to eat, shop, visit. The full breakfast each morning is way above average. We felt like we were home and were treated as family while we were there. It will definitely be our hotel of choice when we return to Rome!!

Reviews.Title: “Che Bella Cosa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel; friendly, helpful staff. Excellent location. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “bella alimandi”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is not an awful lot you can say that has not been written already about this 'gem of a hotel'.The staff are so helpful.We arrived on a tuesday morning and the rooms were ready for us.Bags duly dropped off I enquired about local restaurants.After getting directions from the hotel owner,he asked did we want tickets for the 'PAPAL AUDIENCE' on wednesday morning.What an experience it turned out to be.Due to the weather it was held indoors.I can only describe it as a 'once in a lifetime' experience.And it was free.The breakfast was excellent and varied.The rooms and bathroom were tastefully decorated.When we return to Rome we will definately stay at the Alimandi and will recommend this hotel to anyone who intends to visit such a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “The best location ~ First Class!!”
Reviews.Author: NancyAnn31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located directly across the street from the entrance to the Vatican Museums!! Enjoy a HUGE varied buffet breakfast and get in line early by just crossing the street!! Rooms are large, beautifully appointed with marble, and immaculate. We arrived with four people attending a wedding on New Years' Eve needing lots of assistance and they were always gracious!! Would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “A true find!”
Reviews.Author: Rogerlaw1
Reviews.Content: This almost new, spotless, modern but classic gem is staffed by warm and knowledgeable people. The price for Rome is a huge bargain, and the location is convenient and charming. We have been all over Italy several times, and this wonderful place is one we will certainly return to.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: sheridansb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 4 star hotel, right across from the Vatican Museums/Sistene Chapel. Very clean rooms, absolutely the best staff (very accomidating) amazing breakfast buffet - one of the best hotels we stayed at - AND a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport! We will definately visit again!
